loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 37-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a timber retail store where he sells lumber. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a profitable area and his primary customers are local residents and institutions. 

Robert describes his biggest business challenge to be unavailability of tree seedlings in the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy tree seedlings and trees for making lumber. His business goal is to expand and establish a tree nursery within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self-reliant. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy tree seedlings and trees for making lumber

loans.name: Maa Mahamayee Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Mahamayee Self Help Group consists of 13 members of whom all are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. One of them is Jhrana who was selected as their president. 

Jhrana is a 22-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children. The lady sitting in the middle wearing a blue saree is Jhrana. Her husband works as a labourer in a factory situated near her village. She runs a variety shop to help her husband financially. She sells betel, grains, lentils, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

Jhrana has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to meet her customers' demand. She also wants to purchase items for her shop in bulk, directly from the wholesalers. For this she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, rice and other household consumables. Jhrana, along with her group members, has requested a loan amount of 195,000 INR.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, rice and other household consumables for her variety shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 54-year-old single woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 20 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be trustworthy and self-driven. She operates a livestock farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in an area conducive for business, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of adequate funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more dairy cows. Her business goal is to be a wholesale supplier of diary products within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be a large scale producer of milk. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more dairy cows.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Doña Gloria tiene una edad de 43 años, ella es casada, ama de casa y agricultora, madre de tres hijos los cuales estudian y juntos en familia en compañía de su esposo elaboran las diferentes actividades en el campo como ser: corte, limpia, abono entre otras. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el sexto grado gracias al esfuerzo, dedicación y apoyo de sus padres mismos que la educaron y le enseñaron el valor de la vida la responsabilidad a cada una de sus actividades y compromisos para con sus clientes. La tierra que en compañía de sus hijos y su esposo trabajan es propia la cual está ubicada a unos pocos metros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.   

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para dar mantenimiento y asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café ya que es fuente de ingreso económico para su familia y hogar.

Sus planes son los de poder realizar un cambio para bien en sus cultivos para sacar una excelente cosecha y posteriormente poder sembrar más café en una parcela de tierra que tiene a parte para poder generar más ingresos y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y a su pareja en la canasta básica entre otros.
texts.en:
Gloria, 43, is married.  She's a housewife, a farmer, and the mother of three children who attend school.  She completed the sixth grade of elementary school thanks to the effort, dedication, and support of her own parents, who raised her and taught her the value of life and her responsibility to each one of her jobs and commitments to her customers.

With her family and her husband she carries out a variety of activities in the fields, including cutting, weeding, and fertilizing.  The land she and her husband and children work is her own.  It's located a few meters away from her house, so they walk there every day.

She has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to take care of and provide technical assistance for her coffee crops because it's her source of income for her family and household.

Her plans are to make a change for the good in her crops to get an excellent harvest and later be able to plant more coffee on her plot of land.  She also plans to generate more income so she can continue supporting her children in their studies and her husband with the household necessities and other things.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is 20 years old and single. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Fizuli city. Now Saida lives in the Fizuli region with her family. For the past two years, she has been growing and selling cattle.

Saida is requesting a 2,300 AZN loan to buy more calves. She will use the money from her loan for her family's future. In the future, Saida wants to have a big farm for sheep and cattle. She also wants to get married and have a big family with four children. Saida is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Nkio

texts.en:
Nkio is a 55-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 12 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be credible. She does an animal trade whereby she sells goats and calves. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a dependable and profitable area, and her primary customers are local business people and residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices of the animals. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy goats for resale. Her business goal is to be a leading animal trader within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-reliant. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Evelith

texts.es:
Evelith, de 27 años es madre soltera de dos hijos con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres. Evelith se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas de diversas marcas y sabores, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora en un pequeño local en su hogar, donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Se inició hace más de 04 años con un capital propio y actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres quienes atienden cuando ella está fuera de casa. Le gusta su actividad ya que le permiten estar ocupada  y tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Escogió éste negocio porque vio poca competencia por la zona. Las ganancias que obtiene le traen tranquilidad emocional y financiera. Por otro lado viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene planes de mejorar e implementar su negocio y comprarse otra refrigeradora. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero recibido ya que esto le permite seguir adelante con s negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, comprará bebidas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, buscando precios bajos por sus compras al por mayor.
texts.en:
Evelith, 27, is a single mother of two children with whom she lives in her parents' house.

Evelith sells cold beverages in a variety of brands and flavors.  She has a refrigerator in a small space in her house, where she serves her customers in a friendly and cordial manner.  She started more than four years ago with her own capital and currently has the support of her parents, who tend to the business when she's not home.

She likes her job because it allows her to stay busy and have an income to pay for her household expenses.  She chose this business because she saw little competition in the area.  Her profits give her emotional and financial peace.  In light of the good results she's getting, she has plans to improve and set up her business and buy herself another refrigerator.

This is her fourth Kiva loan and she's grateful for the financial help she has received because it allows her to get ahead with her business.  In addition, she promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 800 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy beverages of various brands and sizes, looking for low prices with wholesale purchases.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages wholesale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail store where she sells fruits and bananas. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a highly profitable area, and her primary customers are local residents and traders. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of constant supply of goods throughout the year. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy bananas for selling. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be profitable and independent. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy bananas for selling.

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en:
Satenik lives in Qarahunj village which is located in the Syuniq region. Together with her husband, Satenik is a devoted parent of three school children. She and her family have been involved in agriculture for 20 years. They run a farm which includes cows, chickens and piglets, and also own a plot of agricultural land where wheat, haricot (beans), potatoes and greens are cultivated. 

For many years Satenik has been also working at a local bakery. However, the main income that her family has is from the farming business. Their farm is not a very big one, but Satenik and her husband plan and desire to make it rich and profitable. For this they need financial support and have applied for this loan. With the loan's help Satenik plans to purchase 2 cows and 3 pigs. She thinks that this purchase will bring a good profit to her family and they will be able to improve their life.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows and 3 pigs.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline is a 25-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells wheat flour, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and all types of people are her customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to own a bigger shop within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru: Аскар 37-летний женатый мужчина, проживающий со своей семьей в районе Шахритус в селе Свердлов. Аскар является счастливым отцом. У него 5 заботливых дочерей, которые одновременно и учатся в школе и помогают в домашнем хозяйстве. Сам Аскар мастер по ремонту домов. Это сезонная работа и иногда ему трудно получить заказ. Поэтому Аскар решил начать бизнес в новой сфере. Он выбрал животноводческую деятельность, а именно куплю и продажу крупнорогатого скота, так как это прибыльный бизнес вне зависимости от сезона года. У Аскара есть опыт в разведении скота, так как у них в домашнем хозяйстве имеются коровы. Аскар просит кредит для закупа 6 голов бычков. Он планирует каждый месяц закупать по 6 голов крупноргатого скота, откармливать в течение месяца и затем выводить на продажу на скотный рынок района. Аскар верит, что его новый бизнес будет успешным и приносить хорошую прибыль, в результате которого улучшится финансовое состояние семьи. Он ждет от вас поддержки.
texts.en: Askar is a 37-year old married man living with his family in the village of Sverdlov on the Shahrituz region. Askar has been blessed by five caring daughters who attend school and also help out with household duties. Askar is a building contractor. This work is seasonal, and sometimes it is hard to find customers. This is why Askar decided to launch a business in a different field. He has chosen to raise livestock, more specifically to buy and resell cattle, as this business brings in revenues year round. Askar has experience taking care of animals since his family already keeps cows. Askar is requesting a loan to buy six young bulls. He plans to buy six heads of cattle every month, fatten them for a month and then bring to the animal market in the region. Askar believes that his new business will be successful and bring in good revenues, and, as a result, the financial well-being of his family will improve. He is counting on your support.

loans.use: to buy six bulls and calves so as to launch his livestock business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 23-year-old single woman. She has two children with ages 1 year and 6 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a busy market, and her primary customers are commercial customers and individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for the purchase of stock to meet demand. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to purchase more stock, i.e., flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. Her business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her livelihood and have a sustainable business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, i.e., flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 37-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a salon and a boutique where she does hair treatment and weaving and also sells baby clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area good for business, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost the business. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy salon and boutique items like hair weaves, cosmetics, clothes, etc., for resale. Her business goal is to have a salon training college within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will earn more income. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy salon and boutique items like hair weaves, cosmetics, clothes, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children and she describes herself as aggressive. She operates a retail store where she sells second hand clothes. e.g. shirts, skirts and jackets, etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a potential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to add a stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to be an importer of clothes within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable  business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Izabella

texts.en:
Izabella is from Armavir town where she lives with her two daughters. Her elder daughter, Diana, is a student at Yerevan State University. Izabella works at one of the locals companies and works hard to sustain her family. Unfortunately, her income is hardly enough to cover the daily costs of her family and she is not able to save money for Diana's education.

Izabella is requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition. She waits for lender support to be able to give her daughter an opportunity to accomplish her education.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is 45 years old and married with six children. Zita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business which involves direct selling Sara Lee products in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Zita has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business for five years and also earns an income from a general store and from buying and selling charcoal, dried fish and vegetables.

Zita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Xenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Xenia works hard to support her family. She has a hollow block-making business in the Philippines, and also earns income from motorcycle transport. Xenia is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional sand and cement for her hollow block-making business.

Xenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sand and cement for her business

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maryjane is 41 years old and her three children are in school.

Maryjane has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maryjane requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, ground rice, etc.

Maryjane has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Maryjane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, ground rice, etc.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie is married and has a hollow block making business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sand, gravels and cement for her business. Rosalie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sand, gravels and cement for her business

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Myla works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from buying and selling vegetables and spices. Myla is borrowing PHP 4000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Myla has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Yerevan with her husband, mother-in-law, and two daughters. She works as a seller at a  local shop and sustains her family's living. Anahit's elder daughter, Meri, is 19 years old and is a student at the Armenian National Agrarian University. 

Anahit is requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition. It is very important for her to provide for her family's needs and at the same time save money for her daughter's education. Anahit waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Mahfooz

texts.en: Mahfooz is 25 years old. He is a hard-working and responsible person who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He saved a small amount of capital to establish his business.  He has had a grocery store for one year and his business has been growing little by little, as he offers good prices and gives good service to his customers. He is asking for a youth loan of YER 120,000 to purchase grocery products for his business. He hopes that this loan will increase the goods displayed and, thus, improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for his business.

loans.name: Atman

texts.en:
300,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) would be of help to this ethnic Egyptian Albanian lady, Atman, who lives in a major city in the southeastern part of Albania.

Atman is in her early sixties and people who have known her have commented on her hard-working and ambitious traits. “She is a very lovely lady and she works so hard, even at her age, to provide for her husband and herself. I remember her, offering the services of seamstress and general alterations for some years now, and literally, she’s been trying to accommodate all of us who are in need of her services. She is a very nice lady.” said someone in her neighborhood. 

Atman wants to buy a vehicle with this loan to offer services to clients at their own location.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle, in order to offer services to clients at their nearest location

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 30-year-old Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be humble and respectful. She operates a beauty salon where she does hair treatment, hair braiding, etc. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are women. 

Beatrice will use the Kes 55,000 loan to add stock of hair weaves, cosmetics and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will start a family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of Kes 20,000 and Kes 50,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add to her stock of hair weaves, cosmetics and other items

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 24-year-old single woman. She has one child who is one year old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells bananas and maize. She has been involved in this business for one year. She also has a farm where she grows maize and bananas.

Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are local commercial customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital for expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs to increase her supply of maize and bananas. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her livelihood. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and other farm inputs to increase her supply of maize and bananas

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has three children. She is a hawker and she sells  clothes in the streets. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. 

Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more clothes and other items to sell. Her business goal is to operate a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more clothes and other items to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 53 years old and married with three children.

Marina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

Marina has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut meat and direct selling Avon products.

Marina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 4,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food vending business. Daisy has been in this business for 3 years. She also earns more income from a prepaid mobile load (prepaid cellular phone credits) business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and married with six children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like coffee, milk, cream, spices, etc.

Delia has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 31 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Delia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like coffee, milk, cream, spices, etc

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Rosa has been in this business for 4 years. Rosa also earns income from food vending and buying and selling vegetables.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a loan of PHP 6500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ramela

texts.en:
Ramela is from the Khot village in the Syunik region, where she lives with her son, daughter-in-law and 3 grandchildren. Ramela is a teacher with 20 years of teaching experience at a local school. However, in order to tackle the family's financial problems she got involved in agriculture 6 years ago. Now she owns a small but beautiful farm where she keeps 2 cows and 2 piglets. 

She has realized that breeding cattle is more profitable and that she can solve her family's living problems. She has requested this loan to purchase 5 calves. This will enable her to get milk, use it in cheese production and gather more income. Among numerous maintenance problems in her life, Ramela wants to solve the one that is the most urgent now -- she wants to repair the house and improve her family's living conditions.

Ramela waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay for 5 calves.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is 23 years old. He is a single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is an employee who earns a low salary. Maher exerts as much effort as he can to save money to buy a taxi, but his salary and savings are not enough. He dreams of the good life. 

Maher is requesting a 300,000 YER youth loan from AMB to buy a taxi to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a taxi

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman and has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a hardware store where she sells iron sheets and plywood. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are builders. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add stock of iron sheets, plywood and other items for resale. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of iron sheets, plywood and other items for resale.

loans.name: Marame F's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composés de sept femmes habitant dans le même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et économiques.
Madame Marame est la responsable depuis sa création. Elle est âgée de 61 ans mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 4 garçons et 5 filles .Son fils ainé est âgée de 40 et le cadet âgée de 20 ans.
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente d’arachide.Son nouveau crédit de 400000 francs cfa lui permettra de se payer 5 tonne d’arachide à 275000 francs et 20 paniers de mangues a 100000 francs cfa.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses alimentaires et sanitaires de sa familles.
texts.en:
This group consists of seven women who live in the same district and who are united by good social and economic relations. Marame has been the group's representative since its creation. She is 61 years old and married with nine children, four boys and five girls. Her eldest son is 40 years old and her youngest is 20 years old.

Marame is an active merchant who sells peanuts. Her new loan of 400,000 Francs CFA will enable her to purchase five tons of peanuts for 275,000 Francs, and 20 baskets of mangoes for 100,000 Francs CFA. The income she earns from her business will allow Marame to pay for the food and health expenses of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of peanuts and baskets of mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter in Goris town. Since Anzhela was married, she and her husband have been engaged in farming and agriculture. Now they keep 25 piglets and 2 cows. Anzhela's husband works at a local company and earns a monthly income, which is vital for covering the family's needs. Anzhela doesn't work as she has to take care of her little daughter. She manages the farming activities and gets some stable income from agriculture. 

Now, realizing that the agricultural business is very important for them, Anzhela and her husband would like to expand it. Anzhela has requested this loan to purchase 3 more cows. This will enable her to gather more dairy products and sell them at the local market.

Anzhela and her husband are very hardworking and are devoted to their work. They hope that Kiva lenders will support them so they can enrich their farm and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a prepaid mobile phone load (prepaid cellular phone credits) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables and also selling cellphone units. Victoria is borrowing 5,500 through NWTF to buy additional prepaid mobile phone load to resell for her prepaid mobile phone load business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid mobile phone load to resell

loans.name: Lyne

texts.en:
Lyne is 27 years old and married with two children.

Lyne works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store like cheese curls, canned goods, egg, noodles, etc.

Lyne has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Lyne aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store like cheese curls, canned goods, egg, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Burbuqe

texts.en:
Kindly note that the photo of Burbuqe has been taken at the soon-to-be hair salon, and this is why there is not much displayed in the picture. This start-up loan will enable her to buy equipment and accessories to be used in her new hair salon.
 
Based on thorough research of existing beauty salons in her area, Burbuqe found out that there was a demand for such places/services. She decided to start up such an operation, and she has expressed her passion about it. She worked as a hair stylist in Greece; she lived there for a very long time. Yet, before immigrating to Greece, she was a hair stylist in her home city as well.

Recently, due to the economic difficulties in Greece, she came back to that city and is trying to put her skills to use again. “This will be it - no more moving around. I’m here for good this time. I like it here, it’s my home,” she said, sounding content with her decision. 

Burbuqe is married and has three children.

loans.use: to start up a hair salon business in her homeland.

loans.name: Aghunik

texts.en:
Aghunik is 48 years old and she is already skilled and devoted to her work as a farmer who manages agriculture well. Her farm includes cows, chickens and pigs, and she also cultivates wheat, barley and greens. 

She lives with her husband who helps her with farming activities. Aghunik is sure that she can enlarge their farm and earn a greater profit from it. She wants to increase the number of her livestock by 30 sheep, which is why she is requesting this loan. The loan is very important for her to gather more income and to be able to improve her and her husband's living conditions.

Aghunik has many plans for her farm and she hopes that this loan is one of the first successful steps to reaching her goals.

loans.use: to pay for 30 sheep.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is from Yerevan where she lives with her husband and two children: a 22-year-old son and a 20-year-old daughter. Liana is a teacher at a local school and her husband works at one of the local companies. Liana's daughter, Lusine, studies at the Yerevan State Linguistic University named after V. Bryusov. Liana and her husband work really hard to sustain their family and give their children appropriate living conditions. Unfortunately, their income is hardly enough to cover the family's basic living costs and there is no money left for their daughter's education. 

Liana is requesting a loan to pay Lusine's university tuition. The family waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Jully

texts.es:
Jully, de 26 años de edad, está casada con Carlos y tiene 2 hijos pequeños con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres. Jully, se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en una tienda instalada en el interior de la casa de sus padres, donde vende productos como arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceites, fideos y otros a sus clientes. 
Se inicio hace más de 04 años, con un capital propio, al cual fue haciendo crecer con los productos que vende a diario. Le gusta su actividad pues puede contar con un ingreso económico que le permite apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de alimentación y la crianza de sus hijos, ya que muchas veces con el ingreso económico de su esposo no les alcanzaba , por está razón pasaron algunas necesidades, siendo ayudados por sus padres. Viendo que eso no podía continuar así decidió iniciar su negocio, ahora cuenta con una regular clientela y  tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y con las ganancias comprarse una pierna ortopédica. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Jully is 26 years old and is married to Carlos. They have two young children who live with them at home. Jully makes a living by selling food products in a store located inside of her parents home. She sells products like rice, sugar, eggs, oil, noodles, and other things to her customers.

She started her business over 4 years ago, with her own capital, and she has been able to increase that capital due to the products that she sells daily. She likes her job because she can count on income, which she uses to help her husband with the cost of food and raising their children.

Many times, her husband's income wasn't enough, so they had to seek help from her parents. Because she knew they couldn't continue this way, she decided to start her own business, and now has regular customers and plans to expand her business. With the profits, she plans to buy a prosthetic leg.

This is her third loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support that she has received to move her family forward. She promises to pay her dues on time. With the requested loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she will buy food products like rice, sugar, noodles, candy, and others.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, and others.

loans.name: Douta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé en mai 2010.IL est composé de membres issus de la même localité.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 53 ans,est mariée et mére de 06 enfants dont 03 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de jus de bissap,de pain de singe,du thé,de l'huile de palme et de l'encens.Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce prêt,elle compte acheter un sac de pain de singe à3500f,une bassine de bissap à 2000f,01 bidon de 20l de l'huile de palme à 20000f,un sac de sucre à 20000f,60 paquets de thé à 8000f et de l'encens pour une valeur de 30000f.
texts.en:
This group was established in May 2010. It is composed of members who come from the same community. Their main occupations are running small businesses.

The representative of the group is shown in the photo on the far right, with her arm raised. She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of six children, including three girls. Her small business includes the sale of bissap (juice made from hibiscus flowers), monkey bread, tea, palm oil and incense. She has been running this business for several years.

With this loan, she plans to buy a bag of monkey bread at 3,500 Francs, a basin of bissap at 2,000 Francs, a 20L canister of palm oil at 20,000 Francs, a sack of sugar at 20,000 Francs, 60 packets of tea at 8,000 Francs, and 30,000 Francs' worth of incense.

loans.use: to purchase bissap (juice made from hibiscus flowers), monkey bread, tea, palm oil and incense.

loans.name: Virgen Purificada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Basilia ella es casada y tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.


 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Virgen Purificada" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

The member Basilia is married, is 47 years old and has 2 children. She works in her grocery store business, selling products of basic need like rice, sugar, milk and oil. She has a stall in the market that is a grocery store, and works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She has had this business for 7 years and it is going well. He dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is asking for the loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The other members make a living from a bookstore business, a clothing sales business, a grocery store business and a taxi services business.  
 
Basilia thanks those who form part of this dream in this manner and she commits to complying with the payment of her fees in the established period.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 31 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. Merlita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins.

Merlita has been raising poultry for 5 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Argina

texts.en:
Argina is from Aravus village in the Syuniq region. She lives together with her husband and 22-year-old son who serves in the army. Together with her husband, Argina has been running their farm for 16 years. Currently, they keep on the farm cows, sheep and bulls, and also cultivate some vegetables (wheat, barley and greens) on the family's own land. The gathered harvest is for feeding the livestock and not for sale.

Argina and her husband work hard to make a good income and be able to meet their basic needs. They are sure that they can enlarge their farm and make it more profitable. For this purpose, Argina is requesting a loan to purchase 3 more cows. This loan is very important for them, because with its help they will be able to gather more income and make their life better.

Also, Argina wants to increase her income so she will be able to save money for her son to come back and make his own family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows.

loans.name: Jorgea

texts.en:
Jorgea is 51 years old and widowed with four children.

Jorgea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Jorgea has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming and selling vegetables.

Jorgea aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a welding shop in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming rice and vegetables. Evelyn is borrowing 19000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her welding shop.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her business.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Cheryl from Bulawayo. She is divorced and stays with her three children. Two of her children go to school. Cheryl runs a retail business selling various clothing items and footwear for both kids, men and women. The business has been in operation for over 10 years. She says the main challenges that she faces are the lack of adequate working capital and competition from bigger retailers who offer credit facilities. Cheryl has requested a loan of $500 to replenish her stocks and introduce new products for the winter season, as well as other winter goods like blankets and winter jackets. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to supplement her household income and improve her business capacity. In the future, Cheryl plans to open a clothing boutique.

loans.use: to increase her stock of various clothing items.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a food vending business in the Philippines for 15 years, and earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Deborah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money for business expansion in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Benkadi Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI VI  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec MINATA ,3 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi VI group are all married women, averaging 35 years of age, with five children. They all live in polygamous families in Komo, a village in the [prefecture of] Baguineda in the second administrative district of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan, having duly repaid their prior loans.
They grow millet, which is the case of Minata, for example. She is the third one standing from the left in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] and seeds and pay the cost of labor to work 0.5 ha [about one acre] of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce at the village market to a customer base composed of both resellers and consumers. She plans to earn 100,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. These revenues will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband meet everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her business buying and selling dried coconut meat. Daisy has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from farming vegetables.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lourdes works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and earns additional income selling prepaid mobile loads and farming rice. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy stocks such as soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc. for her store.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 58 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Perla is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Perla has been raising pigs for 3 years and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 50-year-old Sheila from Bulawayo. She is a single mother with one child. Sheila runs a retail business. She sells a variety of clothing and footwear items for men, kids and women. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenges faced that she faces are competition from bigger retailers and exorbitant import duties at the border. Sheila has requested a loan of $400 to replenish her stock and buy a new stock for winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve both her business and her lifestyle. In the future, Sheila plans to open a clothing boutique.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her flea market, including blankets, dresses, men's trousers, ladies' tops, blouses, kids' tracksuits, ladies' and men's jeans.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a 34-year-old man from Gicumbi District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. Deo started selling lights in December 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people.

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Agnes, and their 5 children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Doña Marina es una mujer de 46 años casada y madre de 2 hijos, ama de casa y agricultora desde su juventud con 6 años de educación primaria cursados. En la agricultura solo ella y su esposo se involucran desde hace más de 10 años pero fueron sus padres los que en su juventud le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra en lo que es el cultivo de maíz, frijol, y café principalmente. La tierra que ella y su esposo trabajan es propia gracias al esfuerzo que juntos han hecho al abstenerse de muchas cosas para poder algún día tener algo propio.

Ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para poder tecnificar sus cultivos de café ya que de esa forma ella podrá proteger sus cultivos de café de la broca que es un bicho dañino y de la roya como enfermedad.

Su sueño es poder extender y ampliar sus cultivos en variedad y calidad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes más de lo que ellos buscan y así poder cubrir sus expectativas ya que de esa forma ella podrá generar mayores ingresos para su familia, podrá apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios ya que su sueño es verlos crecer y convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old, married and the mother of two children.  She is head of the household and has worked in agriculture since she was young, having 6 years of education.  Only she and her husband work in agriculture, and have for more than 10 years, but it was her parents who taught her to work with the earth when she was young.  She cultivates primarily corn, beans and coffee.  The earth that she and her husband work in is their own, thanks to the hard work they have put into being frugal to be able to one day have something of their own.

She has requested a loan from COMIXMUL to be able to give better care to her coffee plants, and in this way she will be able to protect her coffee plants from a harmful pests.

Her dream is to be able to extend and increase the variety and quality of her plants to be able to offer more of what her clients are looking for and meet her goals.  In this way she will generate more income for her family and will be able to support her children in their studies.  Her dream is to see them grow and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee plants

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 42-year-old man from Gicumbi District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. Alfred started selling lights in December 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. 

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Grace, and their child.

loans.use: to buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 36-year-old man from the Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Antoine started selling lights in September 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people.

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Felecite, and their children.

loans.use: To pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 33-year-old man from the Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Jean started selling lights in July, 2012 and he has sold 50 lights to date, providing clean energy to 250 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Epiphania, and their 4 children.

loans.use: To buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es: Lleny, de 48 años de edad, está casada con Eduardo quien es empleado y padre de sus 03 hijos.  Vive en compañía de su esposo  y sus 02 nietos en su casa propia. LLleny se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, para eso abrió una pequeña tienda en su hogar donde tiene a la venta productos como azúcar, arroz, aceites, bebidas, golosinas y otros. Se incio hace más de  15 años en está actividad y hasta el momento  cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y el de su familia. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite estar  en casa y cuidar  de sus nietos menores a los que quiere mucho, además de los ingresos económicos que le permiten ayudar a esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Este es su tercer préstamo con kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche , entre otros, al por mayor.
texts.en:
Lleny is 48 years old and is married to Eduardo, who is employed. They have 3 children. Lleny and her husband live in their own home with their two grandchildren. 

Lleny makes a living by selling food products out of a small store that she opened in her home. She sells products like sugar, rice, oil, drinks, candy, and other things. She has been working in this business for more than 15 years, and she still has the support of her husband and her family. 

She likes her business because it allows her to be at home caring for her young grandchildren whom she loves very much. Additionally, her income allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.

This is her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives to move her family forward. She promises to pay her dues on time.

With this loan of 1200 nuevos soles, she will buy products like rice, sugar, oil, milk, and others, all in bulk.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, and others.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his father appears in his Kiva profile photo. The picture was taken in the store where he purchased the refrigerator.

Mohammad is a 21-year-old, single young man from Khanyounis. He lives in a small house with his family. Mohammad works as a farmer on the family farm. He plants seasonal crops and sells them in the local market. It is a profitable business, but needs a lot of time and care. 

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new refrigerator for the family house. By applying for this loan, Mohammad will help his family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for the family house.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is a 51-year-old woman from the Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

She is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Eugenie started selling lights in May, 2012 and he has sold 60 lights to date, providing clean energy to 300 people. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Frederic

texts.en:
Frederic is a 28-year-old man from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a top-up loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Frederic started selling lights in December, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. His light-recharging business has been fully funded by Kiva. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for the school fees of his 5 children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Haidr

texts.en: Haidr, 25, is a married man living in Ibb, Yemen. He has been operating a shoe shop selling different shoes for men and women. Previously, he worked with his father in this shop to support his family. He attributes its success to his being nice to his customers and selling quality goods at affordable prices. He requested a youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to buy more shoes to expand his business. This improvement will enable him to increase his income. He hopes to open another shoe shop so that he can increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy men's and ladies' shoes to expand his business.

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en:
Sylvestre is a 42-year-old man from the Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Sylvestre started selling lights in June 2012 and has sold 80 lights to date, providing clean energy to 400 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife and family.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is a 42-year-old man from the Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a top-up loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 additional rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Jean Damascene started selling lights in December 2012 and has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Xaver

texts.en:
Xaver is a 55-year-old man from the Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Xaver started selling lights in December 2012 and has sold 60 lights to date, providing clean energy to 300 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will buy health insurance and pay for the medical costs of his wife Beatrice and 3 children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is a 34-year-old man from the Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Jean Claude started selling lights in August 2012 and has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Marie Chantel, and their 3 children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 30-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Emmanuel started selling lights in August, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will be able to provide a better home for his family.

loans.use: to pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is a 42-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Jean Marie Vianney started selling lights in August 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 43 años de edad, esta casada con Elmer y tiene 03 hijos de 20, 16 y 06 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Gloria se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar,  fideos, avena, entre otros, en la tienda que tiene en el interior de su hogar. Se inicio hace más de 04 años en está actividad y hasta el momento lo realiza sin problema ya que considera que su negocio es bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y por ser su bodega la más surtida de la zona. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite estar  en casa y cuidar de sus hijos menores a los que quiere mucho. Tiene planeado incrementar los productos de su tienda y abrir un nuevo negocio en el cual se dedicara a la venta de comidas. Este será su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old and is married to Elmer. They have 3 children, ages 20, 16, and 6, who live with them in their house. Gloria makes a living by selling food products like rice, sugar, noodles, oatmeal, and other things in the store located inside her home. 

She began this business more than 4 years ago and has been working without a problem. She considers her business to be fairly profitable due to the profits that it provides her and since it is the most well-stocked grocery store in the area. 

She likes her business because it allows her to be home to care for her young children whom she loves very much. She plans to increase the amount of products in her store and open a new business which will sell food.

This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives to move her family forward. She promises to pay her dues on time. With the requested loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, and others.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, and others.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 33 years old, from Gaza. He is married and has children. Two of them attend primary school.

Since 2002, Mahmoud has owned a shop, selling home appliances and furniture. He has two employees who help him.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to build an attic for his furniture shop. Through this loan, he will be able to enlarge the space for product display and, hopefully, increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to build an attic for his furniture shop.

loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.ru: Ихтиёр опытный дехканин, проживающий в районе А.Джоми. Ему 37 лет. У него жена и двое детей. Его жена вместе с ним ведет сельское хозяйство. Ихтиёр скромный и добрый человек. Он имеет среднее образование. У него достаточно богатый опыт в этой области. Он более 13 лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственной культуры. У него имеется 0,25 га приусадебного и президентского земельного участка, где он выращивает картофель, помидор, огурцы, морковь, лук и т.д. Ихтиёр продает полученный урожай и таким образом зарабатывает на жизнь. Он запрашивает кредит для продолжения своей работы, чтобы посеять овощи. На сумму кредита он хочет приобрести семена лука, помидора, огурцов, моркови, кукурузы, а также минеральные удобрения и топливо. Ихтиер за счет полученной прибыли хочет купить скот для домашнего хозяйства.
texts.en: Ikhtiyor is an experienced farmer who is 37 and lives in the A. Jomi region with his wife and two children. He and his wife work on their farm. Ikhtiyor is a humble and kind person and has a high school education. He has extensive experience in agriculture and has been planting crops for over 13 years. He has 0.25 hectares of farmland and grows potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, onions, etc. Ikhtiyor sells his crops to earn a living. He has asked for a loan to buy seeds for onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, and corn, and also mineral fertilizers and fuel, so that he can continue growing vegetables. Ikhtiyor wants to buy cattle for his household with the profits from his next crop.

loans.use: to purchase corn, onion, tomato, cucumber and carrot seeds, as well as fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 2 años, ella  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 1 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, la clienta desea realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, sopas, refrescos, gaseosas, etc. la clienta  asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client lives in her own house with her husband and her 2-year-old son. She has her own store where she sells articles of prime necessity; beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among other items. She has had the business for 1 year, giving her experience in sales that has provided better earnings. The store is located in her house in a heavily-traveled area. She has earned many customers because she has the best-supplied store. People prefer it and they maintain the store against the competition because it always has what they want, with quality products and accessible prices, and with an unequaled service always at the customer's order.

The client wishes to make a new investment but she needs the capital. For this she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL that will permit her to purchase basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks, soups, soft drinks, carbonated beverages, etc. The client assures us that she will be able to pay off the debt and, at the same time, that she is confident she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks, soups, soft drinks and carbonated beverages, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is a 27-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has owned a barbershop for the past 9 years. He has more than 14 years of experience in this occupation; he started to work at a very young age in order to help his father financially and decided to stick with this profession as he believed that it’s his hobby and that he will succeed working it. 

And today, Issam wants to renovate his salon; to do so, he looks forward to have a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. He reports that the renovation will help him attract more customers and therefore he will earn higher income. Issam is very positive and he only aims to improve his business and enhance his way of living.

loans.use: to renovate his salon.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 24, is from Tulkarem.

She is married.

She has owned a tailoring shop since 2012 and has 3 employees who help her.

She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to paint her tailoring shop and buy more fabric.

She hopes that this loan will help her enlarge the scope of work and thus help her improve her family's income.

The one who appears in the picture is Mai's husband. Due to cultural manners, she couldn't take pose for a picture herself.

loans.use: to paint her tailoring shop and buy more fabric.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan, 28, a single man who lives in Hodeida, Yemen, is hardworking and independent. The owner and operator of a bus providing local transportation, he works hard to meet his daily expenses.

Marwan has applied for a youth loan of 149,500 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his bus. He hopes to improve his living standards and buy an extra bus in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen,

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad ella,  se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ana es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su casa vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios para su trabajo como: telas, hilos, elástico, botones, etc. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old and she makes clothing and accessories.  She began this business in her home.  Ana is an incredible woman.  She is hard-working, responsible, and always positive.  Many people give great references about her as a person and a worker.   

She makes a variety of garments and sells them at reasonable prices.  She provides a high quality of work, which is one of the reasons that many people prefer to buy from her.  She has worked in this job for 5 years and she now has a lot of experience and loyal customers that choose to buy from her more and more.  With her income she can cover some of her household expenses.  She lives with her husband and their two children in their own home.

She has decided to ask for a loan so that she can buy the materials she needs for her work, such as fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, etc.  All that she does is done with the goal of providing a great service to her customers so that they always choose to buy from her and so that she can increase her income.  She hopes to one day reach her goal of improving the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Milton Ivan

texts.es: Milton de 32 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, pepino y ejote,  tiene 4 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, abonos,  etc. Milton  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Milton is 32 years old and lives with his wife and their children in their own home.  He works in agriculture and grows corn, cucumbers, and green beans.  He has worked in agriculture for 4 years and so he has gained the experience he needs to bring in a better harvest.  His sells the products from him harvest throughout the community.  He already has a large customer base because people prefer his products due to their great quality, low prices, and above all, good customer service.  

He is seeking a loan so that he can buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides, fertilizers, compost, etc.  Milton has good business references because he is well-known and very responsible.  He assures us that he will be able to pay back the loan in compliance with the established schedule and he is confident that it will help him economically support his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides, fertilizers, compost, etc.

loans.name: Zobeyda Nohemy

texts.es: ZOBEYDA VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD  RURAL. ELLA TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADA Y CON 2 HIJOS: SU HIJA MEYDELIN DE 7 AÑOS, Y SU HIJO MICHAEL DE 5 AÑOS. AMBOS ASISTEN A LA ESCUELA DE LA COMUNIDAD. ZOBEYDA TIENE UNA PULPERIA DESDE HACE UN AÑO, LA CUAL HA SIDO UNA FUENTE DE INGRESO  IMPORTANTE PARA MANTENER SU HOGAR. SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO OBRERO  Y SU SALARIO NO ES SUFICIENTE PARA MANTENER A LA FAMILIA, POR LO QUE PARA AMBOS ES IMPORTANTE TENER ESTE PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO. EN SU COMUNIDAD NO HAY LUZ ELECTRICA  Y ES MUY DIFICIL PARA ELLOS QUE LA PULPERIA FUNCIONE DE NOCHE. ACTUALMENTE USAN CANDELAS, KEROSENE Y FOCOS CON BATERIAS PARA ALUMBRARSE, PERO ESTOS SOLO LES FUNCIONAN POR 2 HORAS. PARA ZOBEYDA Y SU ESPOSO ES IMPORTANTE TENER LUZ EN SU HOGAR PARA QUE SUS HIJOS LOGREN TENER MAYOR SEGURIDAD Y NO ESTEN EXPUESTOS A CUALQUIER ACCIDENTE CON LAS CANDELAS Y ENFERMEDADES POR EL HUMO DE KEROSENE . ES POR ESO QUE ZOBEYDA ESTA SOLICITANDO UN PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE UN PANEL SOLAR  DE 100 WATT EL CUAL BENEFICIARA A TODA LA FAMILIA CON ENERGIA LIMPIA "CON EL PANEL SOLAR PODRE ATENDER POR LAS NOCHES EN LA PULPERIA Y MIS HIJOS HARIAN ALGUNAS TAREAS  ESCOLARES. USANDO CANDELA, KEROSINE Y FOCO GASTO DEMASIADO. REALMENTE ESPERO ME AYUDEN A RECIBIR ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DEL PANEL SOLAR PORQUE ESTOY SEGURA QUE TODAS  LAS VIVIENDAS CERCANAS TAMBIEN SERAN BENEFICIADAS."
texts.en:
Zobeyda lives in a rural community.  She is married and has two children.  Her daughter, Meydelin, is seven years old.  Her son, Michael, is five years old.  Both of them attend the community school.  Zobeyda has had a grocery store for one year.  It has been an important source of income in order to support her household.
