Her husband is a workman, and his salary is not enough to support the family.  Therefore, it is important to both of them to have this small business.

There are no electric lights in her community, and it is very difficult for them to run their grocery store at night.  They currently use candles, kerosene, and lights with batteries to light up the place.  However, these only work for two hours.  It is important to Zobeyda and her husband to have light in their home so that their children manage to be safer and so that they are not exposed to an accident with the candles and illnesses from the kerosene smoke.

That is why Zobeyda is requesting a loan to buy a 100 watt solar panel.  This will benefit the whole family with clean energy.  “With the solar panel I will be able to tend to the grocery store in the evenings and my children will do some school work.  Using candles, kerosene, and lights [run by batteries], I spend too much.  I really hope that you help me get this loan to buy a solar panel because I am sure that all of the houses nearby will also benefit.”

loans.use: to buy a 100 watt solar system for lighting in her home.

loans.name: Savina

texts.en:
Savina is a 70-year-old married woman. She has ten children ranging from 30 to 48 years of age. She describes herself to be motivated. 

Savina operates a cereals business selling maize, beans, and millet. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy market area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of products. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add a stock of maize, beans, and millet. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, and the previous loan of Kes 15,000 was paid successfully.

loans.use: to add a stock of maize, beans, and millet.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 61-year-old married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a farm where he keeps rabbits. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are both men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital to expand. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more rabbits. His business goal is to own a big rabbit farm within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 22-year-old man who lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has completed secondary school. 

Kamal opened a grocery store two years ago. He started his business with limited capital and income, provided by his dad. He did his best to improve and expand his business in order to build his future. 

Due to the current bad situation which Yemen faces, Kamal's business is making less profit and his customers are decreasing. Therefore, he is planning to bring new goods to his grocery store in order to keep his customers and improve his income. 

He has requested a youth loan of YER 160,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) in order to purchase grocery goods, to increase his profit. He hopes that this will enable him to continue running his business successfully and make the business more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods, to increase his profit.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 29-year-old married man and has five children. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen, and he has been selling fresh fruits and vegetables. He currently has his own business, which is the main source of his income. He has had his business for five years. 

Khalid is asking for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. The loan will be used to stock his store better by buying fruits and vegetables like oranges, apples, lemons, potatoes, and onions. 

This will allow him to obtain better daily profits, since his sales will be higher.  This will make it possible for him improve his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like oranges, apples, lemons, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Ghamdan

texts.en:
Ghamdan is young man who lives comfortably in Ibb, Yemen. He is a hard-working man with strong ambitions to move forward in life and to be happy. He has been operating a business that provides generalized wedding services for customers (grooms & brides). He acquires all needed items on regular trips to the capital. He serves his customers with a very friendly and amenable manner, which keeps them loyal to him and recommends him to others, increasing his customer base.

He describes his business as profitable, as it provides him with good earnings. He requested a loan from AMB to further invest in his business. In the future, he dreams that his business will continue to provide income in order to help his family; in that way, he will provide them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in renting wedding supplies to his customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 25-years-old married man. He describes himself as polite. He operates an eyeglass business where he sells spectacles. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more spectacles for resale. His business goal is to own a stall within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more eyeglasses for resale.

loans.name: Adhm

texts.en:
Adhm, a 21-year-old single man, lives in Haja, Yemen, where he is a hardworking sewer. He has striven with great courage in order to provide for his family, laboring very hard so that he can become a professional.

Adhm, who creates and sells clothes to his clients, works daily in his sewing shop and loves what he does. He has applied for a youth loan of 300,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from AMB to buy an additional sewing machine and sewing materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine and sewing materials for his business.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es: DON GASPAR ES UN CIUDADANO DE UNA COMUNIDAD RURAL EN EL VIEJO CHINANDEGA. EL TIENE 59 AÑOS DE EDAD. DE VIVIR EN LA COMUNIDAD TIENE 8 AÑOS CON EL VIVEN SU SEÑORA Y TRES HIJOS. EL ULTIMO DE SUS  HIJOS NACIO EN  MAYO DE ESTE AÑO.  EL TRABAJA EN UN INGENIO DESDE HACE 6 AÑOS EN LA TEMPORADA DE COSECHA DE CAÑA. CUANDO SALE DE TRABAJAR  DEL INGENIO TAMBIEN  TRABAJA EN UNA FINCA CERCANA Y SIEMBRA SU MANZANA DE MAIZ Y FRIJOLES. SUS  HIJAS  ESTÁN  EN CUARTO Y SEGUNDO GRADO DE PRIMARIA ASISTEN A LA ESCUELA MAS CERCANA. EN LA COMUNIDAD NO HAY LUZ ELECTRICA Y ACTUALMENTE SU FAMILIA  ESTA USANDO FOCO DE BATERÍAS PARA ILUMINARSE. ELLOS COMPRAN BATERIAS POR QUE DURAN MAS Y EVITAN QUE OCURRA  ALGUN INCENDIO EN SU CASA  CON EL USO  DE CANDELAS. EL ESTA SOLICITANDO UN PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE UN PANEL SOLAR  DE 60 WATT Y ASÍ VIVIR DE UNA MEJOR  MANERA CON SUS  HIJAS Y SU  SEÑORA. CON ESTE SISTEMA LA INTENCIDAD DE LUZ SERA MAYOR Y YA NO TENDRA QUE GASTAR EN LA COMPRA DE BATERIAS. LAS HIJAS DE DON GASPAR  PODRAN REALIZAR TAREAS ESCOLARES  POR LAS NOCHES Y SU ESPOSA  PUEDE CUIDAR MEJOR AL NIÑO RECIÉN NACIDO.  EL ESPERA LE  AYUDEN CON  LA APROBACION DE EL PRESTAMO PARA QUE SU VIDA FAMILIAR CAMBIE.
texts.en:
Gaspar lives in a rural community in El Viejo, Chanandega.  He is 59 years old.  He has lived in the community for eight years with his wife and three children.  The last of his children was born in May of this year.

He has worked for six years at a sugar refinery during the season for harvesting sugarcane.  When he leaves his work at the sugar refinery he also works at a nearby farm, and he grows his ‘manzana’ [a land measurement unit equivalent to 1.740 acres] of corn and beans.

His daughters are in the fourth and the second grades of elementary school, and they go to the closest school.  In the community there is no electrical lighting.  Currently his family is using lights run by batteries.  They buy batteries because they last longer, and they avoid a fire that could be caused by using candles in their house.

He is requesting the loan to buy a 60 watt solar panel.  This way he will live in a better way with his daughters and his wife.  With this system the intensity of light will be greater, and they will no longer have to spend to buy the batteries.  Gaspar’s daughters will be able to do their school work at night, and his wife will be able to take better care of their newborn child.  He hopes to be helped with the approval of this loan so that his family life will change.

loans.use: to buy a 60 watt solar system in order to have light in his home.

loans.name: Thaier

texts.en:
Thaier is 21 years old and is from Gaza. He has owned a barbershop since 2012 and has one employee who helps him.

Thaier asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy materials for hair styling and furniture that he needs for his barbershop. He hopes that the loan will help him gain more customers and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy materials for hair styling and furniture that he needs for his barbershop

loans.name: Iyyad

texts.en:
Iyyad is 22 years old and is from Ramallah. He opened a clothing shop two years ago and has five years of experience in clothing sales.

Iyyad asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more clothes and accessories for his clothing shop. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and accessories for his clothing shop

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 51-years-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 11 years. He describes himself to be happy. He has an animal sales business where he sells cows. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor prices. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy cows for reselling. His business goal is to be rich within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable and will be able to educate his children. Previously he was selling maize to earn an income. He also sells milk to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy cows for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy five logs of trees.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 25-year-old married man with 3 children living in Sana'a, Yemen. He sells gas cylinders, and he uses his rickshaw to transport his goods. The business is profitable, and he intends to expand it. He has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from AMB to purchase gas cylinders for resale to increase his profit. This loan will help him operate efficiently and increase his route coverage.

loans.use: to purchase gas cylinders for resale to increase his profit.

loans.name: Katenga Turibamwe Group

texts.en:
Jovvy is 49 years of age. She is married with five children, and two dependants who are orphans. She is part of the Katenga Turibamwe group a development group in rural Bushenyi. This is the second time she is taking a loan of ugx. 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings. 

She trades in goats and coffee, with an additional income from decorations. She began her business in 2003, and it is located in a trading centre of a rural area. Most of her clients are located around the coffee factory. 

She hopes to build a family house to accommodate her children and dependants in a more descent housing. Though she faces a problem of fluctuation of prices, she is involved in many businesses and is very hard working.She hope the group will pay diligently to uphold the partnership and she thanks Kiva lenders for the interest they took in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy coffee that she will dry and sell at the factory.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is a married man, aged 46 years, who is also a proud father of six children. He mainly trades in unprocessed tea with additional income from rentals. He started his business in the year 2000, and he has been doing it successfully for 12 years running. 

The money we extended to him amounting to 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings was to buy organic fertilizers to boost his trade and expand the tea plantation. He hopes to educate his children further with the proceeds he gets from the tea trading, as he has an 18-year-old daughter he has successfully educated  who needs university tuition. He is hoping her fellow siblings will follow. John Bosco is hardworking, committed and proud of what he does.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers for his tea plantation.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald resides at Nyabubare cell. He is a long-time client of Ugafode. He runs a restaurant in town as his business. 

Ronald has applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to enable him to buy building materials to complete his rental house, which will give him more income in future than staining the restaurant alone.

He hopes when the money comes as additional income, he will no longer strain his business and therefore increase his income. Ronald is standing on the right, the person to his left is the UGAFODE staff. He hopes to pay back the loan well such that he maintains the partnership.

loans.use: To complete his rental house.

loans.name: Froduard

texts.en:
Froduard is a 28-year-old man from the Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwandan francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Froduard started selling lights in November, 2012, and has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: purchase 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 41-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Vincent started selling lights in May, 2012 and he has sold 110 lights to date, providing clean energy to 550 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business, to earn more money for himself, his wife Grace, and their two children.

loans.use: to pay for ten, low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a 25-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Pascal started selling lights in June, 2012 and he has sold 70 lights to date, providing clean energy to 350 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business, to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for ten, low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es: El Sr.  Omar  de 39  años de edad es casado y tiene tres  personas que dependen económicamente de él.  el Sr   trabaja en una empresa  pequeña   desempeñándose como pintor de Primera   puesto que se ha ganado a base de esfuerzo,  es un hombre de familia siempre buscando y procurando lo mejor para sus hijos. En esta ocasión   está  solicitando un crédito  para poder impermeabilizar su casa y  poner vidrio al Barandal  ya que cuando le instalaron  el portón  no le alcanzo para poner el vidrio,  El sabe que su familia  se merece  lo mejor es por eso que ha tratado siempre de brindarles lo que ellos necesitan y  ofrecerles  la mejor comodidad,   El agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Omar, 39, is married and has 3 dependents.  He works as a painter for a small company, a position that he got through a lot of effort.  He is a family man who is always seeking and procuring the best for his children.  At this time, he is requesting a loan to waterproof his home and install glass in the gated entrance, because when he installed the gate he lacked the funds to put in the glass.  He knows that his family deserves the best, and this is why he has always tried to provide them with what they need and offer them the best comfort.  He is grateful for the help that is being provided.

loans.use: to buy waterproofing supplies and glass for his gated entrance

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en: Eseza is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She has a business selling charcoal and has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works from her home seven days a week and says her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Eseza aspires to become a wholesaler and also to pay for her children's education through to university level. Her family's house does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, a 58-year-old widow and mother of three children, has resided for over 30 years in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis, Occidental. She has made a living operating a retail store that sells a variety of food and home-use products. She earns PHP 5,000 a month from this business. Aside from the earnings, she also raises piglets for sale. She joined GDMPC last year and she is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feed and to build a livestock shelter.
She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed and to build a livestock shelter.

loans.name: Manzi

texts.en:
Manzi is a new client to UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (UGAFODE), from Kajara, Ntungamo District. 

The client lost his goats due to foot and mouth disease. Manzi is a farmer and he has approached UGAFODE to boost his goats business where he buys, fattens, and sells them for profit. He has put in a well structure to protect the goats. 

He hopes to maintain the relationship by paying well and, thereafter, accessing more loans to raise his income and profits, which he could not do without the help of Kiva lenders, through UGAFODE. The second gentleman on the left is the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to buy goats for sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a single father aged 22 years with one child who is 2 years old. He lives in rural setting of Rakai district. He is a businessman who deals in bark-cloth selling (traditional clothing) and he has been in his business since 2001. He started this business in order to earn a living since he dropped out of school at an early age.

Henry sells his products to traders in Kampala city where he takes them once every month. He has acquired this loan in order to purchase stock for his business. He hopes to expand his business and start supplying in big volume and he has a hope of buying a bigger plot of land.

Henry faces challenges in his business which include delay of payments by his customers who sometimes buy on credit and high transport costs. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy bark-cloth in raw form so that he can refine it for sale

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is a young hardworking man of 35 years. He hails from the village of Kyanyanda in Isingiro district. He grew up without his parents after both of them died when he was very young. He was brought up by his grandmother who also died when he was 12 years old. He worked on people’s farms  looking after goats. Because of his trustworthiness, he was given some goats as gifts and that laid a foundation for his success. Vicent looked after these goats and they increased to over 40 in number. He used the goats to pay for the bride price and also to acquire land for his banana farming. Last month he again sold over half of his goats to construct a permanent house. He is requesting a loan of ugx. 3,000,000 to complete his house for the benefit of his family. In the photograph is Vicent with his wife.

loans.use: To complete construction of his house

loans.name: Rwamugooma Uwesso Grp Group

texts.en:
Venansio is a married woman with six children. She lives in the village of Ruhinda in the Rukungiri District. She previously borrowed 500,000 UGX from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI). She used the money to start up a small shop and fence some land for livestock farming. 
She has since developed her business until this month when she applied for another loan with the Rwamugoma Uweso Group. She secured a loan of ugx. 1,000,000 with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) and was enrolled on the KIVA Programme. She said that the money is going to help her improve her farm and add some stock in the shop and she is grateful to KIVA and UGAFODE for the partnership. She is a hard working woman.

loans.use: To hire labourers to plough her farm

loans.name: Kanyamutwe Women's Grp Group

texts.en:
Ntura is a member of Kanyamutwe Womens’ Group of Kebisoni– Rukungiri District. He comes from a Village in Kakinga Parish - Kebisoni Sub - county. He has been a client of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for five years now. 

The money he has been getting from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) helped him to start a small retail business which he has managed to grow into a big shop. He has also ventured in the coffee trade and a piggery business. When KIVA partnered with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), he learned about it and became educated about such funds and was interested because he would be partnering with so many lenders.  

He secured a loan of ugx.1,000,000 Uganda Shillings through the group, which he expects to help him improve and expand his businesses by buying several daily house hold use items needed by his customers. He is a committed client, hard-working, and married with nine children.

He is confident he will be able to educate all his children, which he wouldn't have done without the financial boost from Ugafode.The extra two people are group members who have signed the waiver but are not taking the loan this cycle.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Rwere-Nyabihinga Kwebisaho Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man, aged 35 years, and he has four children. He stays in Rwere – Rwetondo ward. He has been a member of Rwere – Nyabihinga Kwebisaho Group and with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for over six years.

He got to know about KIVA recently, when he was advanced a previous loan with his group. At that time, he received a loan of ugx.1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings.

With his share of this new loan, Patrick is going to diversify his business of brick making, through adding value to the business. He is going to employ people to make more earthen bricks. This will help him provide service to the people around him, and also generate income to meet the needs of his family. Thanks to Kiva and UGAFODE, for giving this opportunity and helping the low income earners who have managed to engage in sustainable development.

loans.use: To hire labour to make bricks

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is a 25-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten, rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Felicien started selling lights in May, 2012 and he has sold 70 lights to date, providing clean energy to 350 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business, to earn more money for himself, his wife Marie, and their one child.

loans.use: to pay for ten, low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 27-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a top-up loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. Emmanuel started selling lights in May, 2012 and he has sold 170 lights to date, providing clean energy to 850 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Speciose, and their child.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is a 49-year-old woman from Gicumbi District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Anastasie started selling lights in December, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money she makes from selling and recharging lights, she will pay the school fees of her five children (Aimable, Christella, Patrick, Clement, and Eric).

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en: Tserendolgor, 24 years old, lives with her husband and 2-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a five-walled Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling). She is a music teacher but currently is not working to look after her daughter. Her husband is currently unemployed. They decided to purchase an automobile to render taxi service to local people. She is requesting a loan of 1300000 MNT to cover the cost of buying an automobile. The borrower and her husband believe that getting the loan for purchasing a car will surely help improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile

loans.name: Thet

texts.en:
Thet (in the photo) sells dessert and fast food in the village. Her husband, Sophy, is a remoque taxi driver. In addition, he is also a chef. 

Thet is in the process of building her house, but the house is not finished yet. Hence, she needs to ask for a loan to complete the work. 

Thet and her husband live in a village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children - two sons and one daughter. 

About 'remoque': In the past, we called these taxis 'tuk-tuks' (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi). But, now the government does not allow use of this name. That’s why we call the taxi 'remoque' instead of 'tuk-tuk'.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages for her business, including soft drinks, beer, juices, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita lives with her family at Punta, Pana-on, Misamis, Occidental. She is 48 years old, married and has five children. Her husband earns income from working in the private sector while she manages their farm of fruits, bananas and vegetables. In 2008, she joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance services and help her improve her business. Recently, she borrowed 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer, such as manure. She hopes to gain a bigger harvest this cropping season in order to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia lives with her seven children in Punta, Pana-on, Misamis, Occidental. Her unmarried children have helped her in her flower-growing business for years since her husband died. She raises flowers and sells them in the market in town, earning 3,000 PHP every month. As a member of GDMPC micro credit since 2008, she recently borrowed 5,000 PHP to buy imported seedlings of flowers and fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to expand her flower farming business to gain more customers and profits and provide better living conditions for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy imported seedlings of flowers and fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is from Seti, Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. She is 46 years old and married with one child. To make a living, Rita owns and operates a general store. Rita has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rita joined GDMPC. Rita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to buy rice and corn grits for sale in addition to her groceries. She hopes to gain more income for the better future of his only child.

loans.use: to  buy rice and corn grits for sale

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is 36 years old and married with three children. He lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis, Occidental where he operates a  business that provides motor transportation to the community. He has been doing this for more than five years. Last year, he joined GDMPC micro credit and he recently borrowed 19,000 PHP to buy a new set of tires and pay for maintenance. He planned to acquire another motorized unit to be used in expanding the services he provides.

loans.use: to buy new set of tires and pay for maintenance

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: Ma. Theresa is living in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. She is 49 years old and married with four children. She owns and manages a general store, selling groceries in her local community to make a living. She has been doing this for more than seven years. She became a member of GDMPC in the year 2011 and it helps her to improve being an entrepreneur. Recently, she borrowed 35,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to acquire rice and corn grits and feed for sale. She plans to make her store a general merchandise business some day.

loans.use: to acquire rice and corn grits and feed for sale

loans.name: Acquilina

texts.en:
Acquilina is from Dinas, Sinacaban. She is 60 years old, widowed, and has four children. 

For more than 20 years, to make a living, Acquilina has cultivated coconuts, bananas, and fruits for sale. She earns PHP 3,500 a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Acquilina joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 12,000, which will be used to buy fertilizer, such as manure, and to pay for weeding costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure, and to pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 42 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Vivencia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Vivencia requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Vivencia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Vivencia would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosadillia

texts.en:
Rosadillia is 41 years old, married, with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosadillia has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks to sell.

Rosadillia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Doña Yolanda tiene una edad de 39 años agricultora desde muy temprana edad ya que en su familia es una tradición y que además es medio de ingreso para su familia en general. Su familia es muy numerosa compuesta por 7 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian en secundaria en diferentes grados de educación, 2 en la escuela y un menor con tan solo un año de edad. En compañía de su esposo se trasladan hasta sus cultivos de café para dar mantenimiento y asistencia ya que también practican hace más de 5 años la apicultura (cría de abejas mieleras)trasladándose hacia las colmenas las cuales están ubicadas a 40 minutos de su casa de habitación en la montaña. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres a los cuales agradece el apoyo y el esfuerzo que en su juventud pusieron para que ella pudiese cursar la primaria completa.   

Hoy Doña Yolanda solicita a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para poder mejorar sus cultivos de café en cuanto al mantenimiento como ser: poda, abono, limpia y fertilización para poder obtener una excelente cosecha al final de la temporada.

Sus metas son las de poder asegurar sus cultivos de café ya que es un medio de ingreso para su familia el cual se debe de mantener sano y limpio de plagas. Sus sueños son los de poder ver a sus hijos graduados en un nivel universitario con carreras de provecho ya que de ellos será el patrimonio que hoy en día ellos están  construyendo para mejorar su administración y llevarlo a otro nivel.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 39, has been working in agriculture from a very young age because it’s her family tradition and also her source of income for her family in general.  Her family is very numerous; she has 7 children four of which attend various grades in secondary school, two are in elementary school and the youngest is only a year old.  She and her husband head out to their fields to care for their coffee crop; they’ve also been working as beekeepers for five years producing honey.  The hives are located in the mountains 40 minutes from home.  She learned this activity from her parents who she thanks for the support and effort they exerted during her youth so that she could complete primary school.

Yolanda is asking Comixmul for a loan to improve her coffee crop and to provide maintenance for it with pruning, fertilizing, weeding and providing manure so that at the end of the season she will obtain an excellent harvest.

Her goals are to be able to safeguard her coffee crop from infestations and to keep it healthy because it’s a source of family income.  Her dreams are to see her children graduate from university with beneficial careers and to build and improve the estate she's creating which in future will be theirs so they can better manage it and take it to another level.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 30 años está casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Rosa se dedica a la venta de comida, jugos y desayunos; todos los días desde muy temprano sale a vender sus jugos entre ellos jugo de naranja, de papaya, y otros, los desayunos que ofrece son pan con huevo, con pollo, con queso, al acercarse la noche empieza con la venta de comedia regionales. Esta labor lo realiza en la vereda de su casa, también se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de productos de limpieza, de esta manera puede tener otros ingresos adicionales a su trabajo principal. El objetivo principal por ahora es el de consolidarse con su negocio de comidas, para ello desea implementar un espacio de mayor amplitud dentro de su casa para poder realizar su trabajo con mayor tranquilidad y calidad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, y agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio y seguirá muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el monto solicitado comprará los ingredientes para elaborar jugos y desayunos como papaya, piñas, azúcar, y otros.
texts.en:
Rosa, 30, is married and lives in her own house along with her husband and their 2 children.  She has a business selling food, juices, and breakfasts.  Each day, she gets up very early to go out and sell her juices, including orange juice, papaya juice, and others.  The breakfasts she offers for sale include bread with eggs, chicken or cheese.  As night approaches, she sells traditional dishes.  She does this work on the sidewalk in front of her home.  She also has a business selling cleaning products door-to-door.  In this way, she can have other income in addition to the income she earns from her main business.

For now, Rosa's main goal is to get established in her food business.  To do this, she wants to set up a bigger space in her home where she can do her work with greater tranquility and quality.  She now requests 1,000 Peruvian soles, and thanks those who are providing the loan that she needs to keep developing her business.  She will continue to be very punctual with her loan payments.  With the sum she requests, she will buy ingredients to make juices and breakfasts, such as papayas, pineapples, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her juices, such as sugar, pineapples, and papayas

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 67 years old, married and has seven children. 

Alfreda is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Alfreda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and additional livestock for her business. Alfreda has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alfreda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbayar, 28 years old, lives with his parents and sister in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. 

For many years, he and his father have been rendering a taxi service to local people. In addition to taxi income, he also has a job as a sentry at a private business entity. His sister is a cook at a restaurant. 

In Mongolia, people over 25 are considered old and their parents urge them to marry. So Enkhbayar is planning to marry in near future and is saving money in preparation. He has a business idea in which he will purchase cattle from the countryside at a lower price and, after butchering them, he sell the meat to local vendors at a little bit higher price. The difference will be his income. 

To implement his idea, Enkhbayar is requesting a loan of MNT 1,500,000 to cover the cost of purchasing cattle. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who is working day and night, literally.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Jelimar

texts.en: Jelimar is 30 years old, married, has one child, and lives in Malibacsan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, he owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation in the local community. He has been doing this for more than five years and earns 5,000 PHP monthly from this. Recently, he became a member of GDMPC micro credit and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to acquire a helmet, a raincoat and other motorcycle accessories. He hopes to provide better living conditions to his entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a helmet, a raincoat, and other motorcycle accessories

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct-sales Avon business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more Avon products to sell. Alejandra has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from selling frozen foods.

Alejandra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 45 years old and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlene requested a 9,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlene has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Arlene would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nancy Yaniris

texts.es:
Nancy es una joven de 22 años de edad emprendedora, luchadora, con muchos sueños y muchas esperanzas en un proyecto al cual le está apostando para ser una empresaria el día de mañana. Ella es perito mercantil y contador público madre de una hija y con el apoyo de su compañero de hogar han decidido crear una línea de producto para limpieza como ser: Cloro, Azistin, Quita Sarro y Cera Liquida. Este proyecto surgió como una necesidad y gracias al apoyo y asesoramiento que ella recibió en FUDEINFA brazo técnico de COMIXMUL pudo capacitarse para emprender un negocio con el cual ella ha logrado salir adelante y crear una clientela la cual visita de casa en casa a pie para su venta por pedido.

Ella se ha acercado a COMIXMUL para poder solicitar un financiamiento el cual le ayude a inyectar un poco de capital a su pequeña empresa la cual utilizara para la compra de químicos para la elaboración de sus productos ya que la demanda ha crecido y no se da abasto con la cantidad que ella elabora para su venta. 

Sus planes son con el tiempo comprar una motocicleta con la cual pueda transportar el producto y movilizarse más rápido y dar una mejor y mayor rapidez a sus clientes con las entregas y los pedidos. Sus sueños son los de poder construir su propia casa, para darle un techo propio a su hija y apoyarla con sus estudios para que ella sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 22-year-old very enterprising and combative young woman with many dreams and hopes for her project, while positioning herself to be an entrepreneur of tomorrow. She is an expert in commerce and a public accountant, and the mother of a daughter. With her home companion's help, she has decided to create a line of cleaning products, to be called “Cloro,” “Azistin,” “Quita Sarro,” and “Cera Liquida.” The project sprang from a need and, thanks to help and advice she received at FUDEINFA, the technical arm of COMIXMUL, Nancy has been trained for launching a business. She has managed to advance her business and create a clientele that she visits, house to house, by foot to solicit sales by order.

Nancy has approached COMIXMUL to solicit financing to help inject a little more capital in her small enterprise. She will use it to purchase chemicals for making her products, since demand has grown and she lacks the quantity of ingredients required to produce enough to match sales. 

Nancy plans to eventually purchase a motorcycle for transporting her products more rapidly, offering better and faster service to her customers with orders and deliveries.

Her dreams are to be able to construct her own house, and to offer her daughter her own roof and help with her studies so that she can become a professional.

loans.use: buy ingredients for making home cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married, with one child. She is 35 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Margarita owns a plot of farm land where she plants bananas and coconuts. She has been in this business for two years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. 

Recently, she has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy fertilizer, such as manure.

In the future, Margarita's plan is to save her profits in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products like rice and sugar to sell in his store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 51 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de tener muchas ganas de sobresalir, es divorciada y vive en compañía de sus dos hijos mayores de 30 y 27 años de edad, en su casa propia.
Carmen se dedica a la repostería, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro educativo, donde le enseñaron a elaborar deliciosas tortas, y pasteles para promociones, bodas y demás acontecimientos sociales, llegando a tener muchos pedidos por el buen trabajo que realiza, y continua actualizándose pues considera que siempre  hay cosas nuevas que  aprender, contando con un horno en su casa, donde realiza todos su preparaciones y atiende a sus clientes desde hace 23 años. Le gusta  la repostería así como las manualidades, se siente a gusto con su oficio pues le ha proporcionado muchas satisfacciones, como los ingresos económicos y el poder de convertirse  en una prospera empresaria, por eso tiene planes de abrir una fuente de soda en su casa. Este será su quinto préstamo con Kiva y se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que recibe para avanzar con su negocio.
Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus tortas tales como harina, azúcar, chocolate, entre otros.
texts.en:
Carmen is 51-years-old, is a working and honest woman, is looking forward to getting ahead, is divorced, and lives with her two older children who are 30 and 27 years of age in their own home. 

Carmen is works by creating pastries, which she learned studying in a school that taught her to make delicious tarts and cakes for promotions, weddings and other social events. She has a lot of requests because she does good work. She continues to improve because she believes that there are always new things to learn. She counts on a furnace at home, where he made all his preparations. She has been serving her customers for 23 years. She likes baking and crafts. She is comfortable with her office because it has provided a lot of satisfaction such as income and the ability to become a thriving business. For this reason she has plans to open a soda fountain in your home.

This will be her fifth loan with Kiva and she is happy with the financial support provided in order to move forward with her business. With the amount requested of 500 new soles, she will buy ingredients to prepare their cakes such as flour, sugar, and chocolate, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase  flour, sugar, and chocolate, among other items

loans.name: Liberato

texts.en:
Liberato, 53 years old, is married, with two children. He lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. 

To make a living, Liberato owns and operates a piggery, raising pigs for sale. He has been doing this for more than six years. 

He borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy feed and piglets to raise. 

In the future, he plans to expand his piggery in order to raise more pigs for sale.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 61 years old and married, with five children. Angeles works very hard to provide for them.

Angeles runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Angeles has been in this business for 34 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 49 years old and married, with eight children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Cristina has a natural medicines retail business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to purchase more natural medicines to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe BENKADI VII  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO, un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  AWA KARIM ,1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 120.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi VII group are married women who are, on average, 45 years old with six children each. They all live in polygamous families in Komo, one of the villages of the commune of Baguineda (second-largest administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Awa Karim, a member of the group, grows groundnuts.  In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.  

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing on 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production in her village and at the market to both consumers and resellers. She is expecting to make a profit of 120,000 CFA francs per growing season.  This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing, to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Helyn Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Helyn, habita en la Comarca San Agustín de Juigalpa, en la finca de sus Padres, trabaja en el sector de la educación como docente desde hace años, es casada cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, no tiene hijos aun. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción para realizar mejoras en su vivienda como cambiar paredes en la parte anexa a la cocina y pago de mano de obra, ya que actualmente es de tabla y se encuentra en mal estado, por lo que necesita comprar piedras canteras, cemento, arena, hierro, bloques entre ortos.
texts.en:
Helyn lives in the Region of San Agustín de Juigalpa, on her parents' property. She has been working in the education sector as a teacher for years. She is married and relies on her husband's support. She doesn't have any children yet. 

She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of construction materials to make improvements to her house such as changing the walls in the annex to the kitchen and for the payment of manual labour. The walls at the moment are boards and are in bad state and that is why she needs to buy quarry stones, cement, sand, iron, blocks and other items.

loans.use: to buy quarry stones, cement, sand, iron, blocks and other items.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita lives with her family in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children. 

For more than five years, to make a living, Nenita has sold snacks and fruits in town, earning enough money for the basic needs of the family. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan of PHP 4,000 from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy ingredients and fruits to sell. 

She hopes to have a sari sari store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony is 43 years old and lives in Bangko, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. For the past years, he has run a transportation business to support his four children.Tony earns 3,000 PHP each month and is a new GDMPC member. Aside from this business, he also owns a farm of coconut, banana and fruit trees. 

Tony is requesting a 3,500 PHP loan from GDMPC Microcredit to finance the costs of weeding maintenance. Nothing makes him happier than seeing his children be successful in their studies. He hopes to use his loan to provide a better education for his children and improve his business.

loans.use: to finance the costs of weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 52 years old and married, with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell in her general store, like cooking oil, laundry soap, bath soap, noodles, and sugar.

Angelita has been in this business for six years and she sells a variety of items, such as cooking oil, laundry soap, bath soap, noodles, and sugar. 

In the future, Angelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store, like cooking oil, laundry soap, bath soap, noodles, and sugar.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Analyn is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Analyn has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell to her customers.

Analyn has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es: Celso, de 41 años de edad, es soltero e independiente, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de sus 04 amigos compartiendo los gastos mutuamente. Celso se dedica a la agricultura para eso se  ha asociado con su padre quien tiene un terreno donde cultivan verduras y diferentes tipos de hortalizas para luego cenderlas en el mercado de su localidad, con el dinero obtenido puede  cubrir pospagos de  sus necesidades básicas, lleva en este negocio cerca de 08 años. Le gusta su actividad pues comparte con su padre un negocio familiar, además siente que los apoya y logra generarse un ingreso económico para pagarse sus gastos personales, comenta que no le agrada cuando alguna plaga quiere malograr sus cosechas pero los combate  a tiempo, para ello cuenta con obreros que contrata para cuidar sus sembríos. Con las ganancias que le deja tiene planes de abrir un restaurante en la ciudad ya que conoce de cocina. Este será su quinto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para su nueva producción.
texts.en:
Celso is 41-years-old, single and independent, lives in a rented house in the company of 4 friends with each of them sharing the costs. Celso works in agriculture with his father who has a land where they grow vegetables and different types of vegetables and then sell them in your local market. With the proceeds he can cover their basic needs. He has bee in this business about 8 years. He likes his job because he can participate with his father in a family business. Also, he feels that this work support him and manages to generate an income to pay for his personal expenses. He says that he does not like when pests wants to ruin their crops, but he combats them in time. He hires workers to tend their crops. With the money that he earns he plans to open a restaurant in the city because he knows how to cook. 

This will be his fifth loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support provided to move forward. Also he agrees to pay their dues on time. With the amount requested of 3000 soles he will buy organic fertilizer for new production.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, de 37 años de edad, está casado con Arita quien es comerciante y madre de sus 03 hijos de 20, 18 y 10 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Cesar se dedica a reparar celulares de todas las marcas. Cada mañana se dirige al mercado de su localidad , en donde tiene un pequeño puesto de trabajo. Se decidió por ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener un oficio que le permitiera tener ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, además de poder manejar su propio horario de trabajo. Por lo contrario comenta que le incomoda cuando sus clientes no recogen a tiempo los  celulares que mandaron a reparar, ya que tiene que almacenarlos en un espacio muy pequeño. Pero esto no lo desanima y continua trabajando ya que tiene planes de continuar con su trabajo para así seguir creciendo. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará repuestos para celulares a precios mucho mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Cesar, 37, is married to Arita, who is a merchant and the mother of their three children, ages 20, 18, and 10, who live with him in his house. Cesar repairs all brands of cell phones. Every morning he heads to his small stand in the local market. He started this business because he needed a profession that would allow him to earn enough income to pay household expenses and his children's education and to set his own work schedule. On the other hand, it's inconvenient when customers don't pick up their repaired phones on time, as he has to store them in his small space. This doesn't discourage him; he keeps working and has plans to keep growing his business.

This is his second loan cycle with Kiva, and he is grateful for the funding to keep making progress. He also promises to make his payments on time. He will use the loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy cell phone parts at better prices.

loans.use: to buy cell phone parts.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old, and a married entrepreneur from Dinas, Sinacaban, with four children. 

She is earning a living from her transport service business. She started it three years ago and she earns PHP 3,000 a month. In addition to this business, she also cooks snacks for sale in the local community. 

Recently, Mary borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy ingredients, like sugar, glutinous rice, and cocoa leaves. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like sugar, glutinous rice, and cocoa leaves.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Daisy has been in this business for six years. Daisy earns more income from vegetable vending and a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food business.

Celia successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is getting a new loan in order to build and expand her business.

NWTF is re-listing Celia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and married with three children, with one child currently in school. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, vinegar, cooking oil, coffee, cream and other groceries. 

Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jezza Lynde

texts.en:
Jezza Lynde is a married woman, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jezza Lynde is 22 years old and has one child who is in school.

Jezza Lynde has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jezza Lynde has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SANANKOROBOUGOU, un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  CHATA , 1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi I group are married women who are, on average, 35 years old with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Sanankorobougou, one of the villages of the commune of Baguineda (second-largest administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution. 

Chata, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 1 hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production in her village and at the market to both consumers and resellers. She is expecting to make a profit of 125,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Jose Fausto

texts.es: Don Jose de 53 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, hasta ahora el negocio le ha dado muy buenos resultados ya se hizo de mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; don jose es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto y sobre todo humilde, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan superarse y llegar al éxito; quiere hacer crecer el negocio pero necesita de capital para compra de material por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. don jose tiene buenas referencias crediticias y está seguro que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Jose, 53, lives with his life partner and two children. He owns a metal workshop, where he makes doors, balconies, grills, and other items. He has been in the business for several years, garnering experience that helps him improve his work each day. The business has been successful, and he has regular customers who seek him out because he does quality work at affordable prices that meets their needs.

Jose is hardworking, honest, and, most of all, modest. He always looks for chances to overcome obstacles and be successful. He wants to grow his business, but he lacks money to buy materials. He has applied to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy iron, metal, tools, etc. Jose has good credit references and is certain he will be able to pay his debt, while bringing his family financial security.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: Isaac  es un  joven de 26 años de edad , trabaja  en una empresa privada y los fines de semana los quiere aprovechar  ofreciendo  el  servicio de  taxi privado, ya que necesita aumentar sus ingresos, está solicitando un crédito por un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar un carro y lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Isaac is a young 26-year-old. He works for a private firm and wants to use his weekends to offer private taxi services because he needs to increase his income. He’s asking for a one-million colon (¢1.000.000) loan to buy a car to reach his objective.

loans.use: to buy a taxi.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is a 22-year-old single mom who lives in Centru Napu, Tudel, Misamis, Occidental. To support the needs of her child, she operates a retail store selling goods in the market. She has been doing business for months. She borrowed 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy more stock like canned goods, vegetables and spices for sale. She hopes to improve her business to have a better living condition in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara works hard to support her family. Clara is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Clara requested a PHP 12000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy materials and tools for fishing.

Clara has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Clara would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for fishing

loans.name: Wilberg Antonio

texts.es: Wilberg de 44 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. El posee una pequeña tienda donde vende golosinas, refrescos, galletas, aceite, azúcar, etc. tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas lo prefieren por su amabilidad y respeto, como todo buen comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, café, acite etc. y poder surtir mas su pequeña tienda. Wilberg  tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wilberg is 44 and lives with his wife and four children. He owns a small shop, where he sells candy, sodas, cookies, oil, sugar, and more. He has operated the business for many years and garnered valuable sales experience that has led to higher profits. The store is in his house, which is located in a well-trafficked area. He has many customers because his store is well stocked, and people appreciate his friendliness and respect.

As any other good merchant, he wants to grow his business and make investments, but he lacks funding. He has applied to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy grains, candy, eggs, bread, beverages, coffee, oil, etc., to stock his small store. Wilberg has good credit references and is certain he can pay his debt, while offering his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy grains, candy, eggs, bread, beverages, coffee, oil, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Doña Juliana de 55 años de edad ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, golosina, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Doña juliana quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que tendrá una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Juliana is 55 and has a shop where she sells basic items: beans, milk, eggs, bread, sweets, and more. She has operated the business for many years and has garnered sales experience that has led to better profits. The shop is in her house and is well known to neighbors. She has many customers because the shop is well stocked. She is able to pay household expenses with the income she earns. She lives in the house with her husband, who is a farmer. 

Juliana wants to grow her business and make an investment, but she lacks funding. She has applied for a loan to buy what she needs for the store. She is certain that she will pay the debt and that she and her husband will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, candy, etc.

loans.name: Karla Azucena

texts.es:
Karla de 36 años de edad, casada con tres hijos menores de edad de 13, 9,3 años, es originaria de Managua lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de país. Karla se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En su ratos libre le gusta disfrutar mucho con su familia en actividades recreativas, prepara platos típicos como “gallo pinto” lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Por lo que lucha día a  día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de bisutería y productos para el hogar  productos como cuadros, retraterías, bolsas de regalos peluches, reloj de pared, cristalería, álbum calculadora. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo surtir su negocio en l comprar  y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Karla agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre  como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Karla is 36 years old, she is married, and she has three children that are 13, 9, and 3 years old.  She is originally from Managua, which is in the central region of the country.  Karla is a very hard-working woman who is responsible and is very driven to achieve her personal goals.  In her free time, she likes to spend time with her family in outdoor activities and to prepare traditional dishes such as "gallo pinto."  Unfortunately, she was not able to attend the university and she was instead obligated to work since she was a child.  For this reason, she fights daily to provide a better future for her small children.

Thanks to God, and to her drive to get ahead, she works as a salesperson, selling accessories and products for the home such as notebooks, gifts, gift baskets, wall clocks, glassware, albums, calculators, etc.  

She works 10 hours per day selling her products, which is a job she does with pleasure.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital so that she can buy and sell products, so that in a not-so-distant future she can earn a higher income.  Karla is thankful for the help that Kiva lenders are providing to her and to the other people that don't have resources, especially in poor countries such as Nicaragua.  With this help, they can find dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to supply her business in the purchase and sale of merchandise such as notebooks, gifts, gift bags, wall clocks, glassware, albums, and calculators.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 58 years old, married, and has one child.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store, like bread, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, snack foods, etc. 

She has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Lolita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store, like bread, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Ariana

texts.es:
Ariana
Diseño de ropa y logos
C 150.000
	Ariana vive en el Barrio 20 de Noviembre en Puntarenas, lugar de mucha pobreza y problemas sociales, ella tiene 20 años de edad y vive con sus hermanos y su mamá quien tiene un negocio y ha trabajado con grupos en la zona de Puntarenas. Ariana se dedica a diseñar  ropa y logos para marcas, además de vestidos, ropa interior y otros. Esta joven emprendedora desea tener su propia empresa, colocar su producto en el mercado y seguir estudiando para mejorar su condición de vida y apoyar económicamente a su familia.
	El objetivo de este préstamo es comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los diseños para muestra y poder empezar a comercializar su producto en la zona de Puntarenas. Ella tiene más de 2 años de experiencia en estas actividades, pero los problemas económicos hacen que las personas busquen el apoyo de instituciones como Fundación Mujer para temporadas especiales y en este caso ella quiere comenzar su idea, mejorar sus conocimientos llevando capacitación en instituciones técnicas para mejorar su trabajo.
	Entre sus metas destaca salir adelante para que su familia y ella tengan un futuro mejor, que puedan seguir  estudiando y apoyar a que su negocio crezca cada día más. Por ahora la dificultada más grande ha sido la económica, pero han encontrado en este programa un apoyo para su micro emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Ariana designs clothing and logos and wishes to borrow C 150000. Ariana lives in Barrio 20 de Noviembre in Puntarenas, a low-income area with social issues. She is 20 and lives with her siblings and mother, who has a business and has worked with groups in Puntarenas. Ariana designs clothing and brand logos, as well as dresses, underwear, and more. This enterprising young woman wants to have her own business, place her merchandise in the market, and continue her education, while improving her circumstances and helping her family financially.

She will use this loan to buy materials to make sample designs that she can start selling in Puntarenas. She has more than two years of experience in this profession, but financial issues make it necessary for people like her to seek support from institutions such as Fundación Mujer for seasonal needs. In this case, Araina wants to get started with her idea and improve her work skills through technical school training.

An important goal is to get ahead so that she and her family will have a brighter future and she can keep studying and growing her business each day. Until now, her greatest obstacle has been funding, but she found support for her micro business through this program.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric, dyes, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 55 years old, and had four children.  She and her spouse manage their businesses; Corazon is a retail store owner; she also raises some hogs in her village.  

She usually earns about PHP 10,000 in her businesses, just enough for daily meals and school fees. She wanted to increase her products, but had insufficient funds, so that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, and soft drinks to sell.

Corazon hopes to keep improving her retail business and hopes she will grow as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, eggs, breads, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and two of the children are in school.

Lydia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lydia has been in this business for 12 years, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 42-year-old married woman and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for eighteen years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Parveen was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family and due to limited resources, none of their four sons were sent to school. Parveen the obligation to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. Her hard work helped her to establish a good client base, but she was having difficulty fulfilling large orders. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf Foundation.  Currently, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 40,000, and her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine, as well as some spools of thread and ribbons in different colors. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, as well as some spools of thread and ribbons in different colors.

loans.name: Bushra
