texts.en:
Bushra, a 35-year-old married mother of four children, has been selling animals for about two years. She buys baby goats at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha. She earns a good profit from her business, and because of her work, is respected in her home. She also helps her husband in all family and financial matters, and is especially proud of sending her son to college for further studies.

Bushra has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now requesting her fourth loan for Rs. 30,000 to purchase two more goats, she expects a boost in her business income as she expands.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 58 años, está casada con  Ernesto de 61 años con quien tiene 06 hijos de los cuales el último es menor de edad y aún está en etapa escolar. Viven cómodamente en su casa propia. Rosa se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras tales como tomates, plátanos, limones, entre otros, su actividad la realiza en el frontis de su hogar donde todos los días coloca una mesa en la que ofrece a la venta todos estos productos. Lo que ofrece al público lo renueva a diario comprando en el mercado de la ciudad las verduras mas frescas y saludables. Trabaja sola la mayor parte del tiempo, pero ocasionalmente su hijo lo ayuda cuando ella tiene que realizar algunas labores del hogar. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 05 años le agrada la comodidad y la tranquilidad con la que puede generar sus ingresos económicos en su casa propia. 
Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque con los dividendos que obtiene de las ventas de sus productos puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos básicos de su hogar, por eso espera instalar mas adelante una bodega en el que tenga productos diversos que vender y incremente sus ganancias  para continuar brindándole todo lo necesario a hijo y  su familia. Este será su tercer préstamo con Kiva y agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para seguir adelante con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles comprará mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras para ponerlos a la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 58, is married to Ernesto, 61, with whom she has six children whereof one is a minor and still goes to school. They live comfortably in the house they own. Rosa works selling fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, plantains, lemons, etc. She carries out this activity in front of her house, where she places a table each day on which she sells all these products. She renews her assortment every day, buying the freshest and healthiest vegetables at the town's market. She works alone most of the time, but sometimes her son helps her with some of the household chores. 

She has been running this business for nearly five years and she enjoys the comfort and peacefulness with which she is able to generate an income in her own house. She likes what she does a lot because with the profit she makes out of selling her products she is able to help her husband with the basic household expenses. In the future she hopes to install a cellar where she can store different products and increase her profits in order to continue providing the necessary for her son and for her family. This will be her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful to those who help her to carry on with her business. She will use the requested loan of 1000 PEN to buy larger quantities of fruits and vegetables and market them through her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Nikki

texts.en:
Nikki is 44 years old and she is from Tudela, Philippines.  She is married and has one child. 

To earn a living, Nikki runs a general store.  She has been in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,600 PHP each month.  Recently, Nikki has requested a new  loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy rice and corn grits to sell.
Nikki joined GDMPC in 2010.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to save up a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been stitching bags for many years. She has been in this line of work for seven years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. She is an expert in stitching bags of different designs and sizes. She has become very famous by providing stylish bags to the people of her community and at the local market. She wants to expand her business, but due to lack of availability of funds, she is not able to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. She has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy spools of thread in various colors, some packs of zippers, buttons, and different fabrics to increase her sales. She is very experienced, and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in various colors, some packs of zippers, buttons, and different fabrics.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence resides in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a very fertile land situated along the slopes of Mt.Kenya.  She is married and has three children.  She has been farming for over twenty years, and her main sources of income are cash crops and milk.

She has requested a loan of KES.30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo which will help her purchase dairy goats for the production of milk. This will boost her income very much, and thus improve her family's living conditions.

The challenges she faces in the course of farming are animal diseases and poor markets.

In five years, she wants to be the leading producer of goats.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for helping her grow her dream.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been doing a business of milk sales with the support of her husband for the past eleven years. 

Shameem has two buffaloes she milks. She looks after the buffaloes, and performs the task of collecting the milk from them; her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. Shameem also sells butter and yogurt that she makes from the milk to the people of her community. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

She requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to purchase one more buffalo so she can cater to more customers. She is in her sixth loan cycle, with a good repayment history. 

She hopes to increase the milk production, which will ultimately help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for her milk sales business.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc is requesting a new loan to buy a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production. Ngoc's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production.

loans.name: Leonel Jeronimo

texts.es: Leonel Jerónimo, mayor de edad casado con cuatro hijos mayores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, Leonel es un hombre que desde muy temprana edad se ha dedicado a trabajar para llevar el sustento a su hogar y que a sus hijos no les faltara nada, con los créditos anteriores que ha obtenido ha ido mejorando poco a poco su vivienda brindándoles una mejor seguridad a sus hijos, él tiene un excelente record crediticio ya que ha sido puntual en el momento de realizar sus abonos, hoy en día Leonel está solicitando financiamiento para instalar cerámica a su casa, (Sala, Porche, cuarto), realizar cambio de zin, clavos, cemento, reparar paredes entre otros.  Uno de sus sueños es poder ver terminada su vivienda
texts.en:
Leonel Jerónimo is an older gentleman with four adult children.  He is from one of the cities in Chinandega.  From a very early age he has worked to support his family and to ensure that his children had everything they needed.  With his previous loans he has been able to make improvements to his home little by little, providing greater security for his children.

He has an excellent credit record and has always been punctual with his loan repayments.  Currently he is seeking a loan in order to install tile flooring in his living room and other rooms.  He will also replace zinc sheeting and repair walls, for which he needs nails, cement and other items. One of his dreams is to be able to finish the improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy tile, cement, zinc sheeting, sand, nails and other items.

loans.name: Ephron

texts.en:
Ephron lives in Kilifi, Kenya. He makes cushions and sells them. This has been his business for the last ten years. He started the business from his personal savings. The business has continued to grow and he has been able to support his family. He knew about Milango through friends and since he wanted credit he decided to join. He now seeks a loan to buy canvas, Kiwi (shoe polish) and animal hides. He has an ambition to buy his own piece of land and build a shop so that he can avoid paying rent that has been cutting his profits.

There are little challenges that affect his business with the major one being taxation. He plans to open other businesses and diversify his earnings. Ephron is 41 years old, a husband and a father of one.

loans.use: to buy canvas, Kiwi (shoe polish) and animal hides.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is 24 years old, a married woman, and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Rehana’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Rehana has applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Rehana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's transportation service vehicle.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 59-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community with the support of her husband for the last four months. Her husband buys stocks of goods from the market at wholesale rates, then she sells them to the people of her community at reasonable prices. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide them with the basic necessities of life. As she wants to grow her business, she requested for a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to deal with more customers time after time. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is a 22-year-old married woman. She is been in the beauty parlor business for two years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 through Kashf Foundation. Asma is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her business and will bring positive changes.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 42-year-old married woman and mother of six children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failed, so she decided to initiate her own business to help her family to improve its future. Six years ago she began her sewing business from her home. She stitches clothes for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. That is why she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase spools of thread, packs of needles, buttons, and ribbons.  She is currently in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, packs of needles, buttons, and ribbons.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 42-year-old lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. Her husband is also a tailor. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine with some more spools of threads in different colors. It will help her to complete the orders of her customers on time.  She is in her 2nd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine with some more spools of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en: Haseena is a 53-year-old widow; she has been in the business of milk sales for the last eight years. She has 5 calves and 2 milk cows. She milks the cows then sells milk to the people of her community. She has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. For the further improvement of her business she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy one more cow and feed for its calves. She is in her third loan cycle. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in increasing sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 24 years old and a married woman. She is a very hard working woman in the business of milk sales for last five years. She has two cows to milk. She sells the milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and yogurt that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to provide her a decent life. She is a mother of three children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. 

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. She requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase one more cow. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 3 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of her group, Amor y Esperanza (love and hope) 3. This group is located in a rural area of La Romana. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She says that her dream is to have her own house, and thanks to the loan and her savings, she has made it possible to plan it.

Maritza is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for almost eight years, starting to sell products. 

Maritza plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different products like clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. She will also use future profits to reinvest in her business and to finish building her house. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Anwari

texts.en: Anwari is a 43-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and five children. She has doing hand embroidery for about twenty years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with pearls and beads. She earns enough to spend a decent life through her business. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy spools of thread in different colors along with some packs of beads, sequins, stones and pearls for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to complete her customers' orders on time, which will help generate more income for her. She dreams of a bright and prosperous future for her children.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors, packs of beads, sequins, stones, and pearls for embellishment.

loans.name: Sharleen

texts.en:
Sharleen is a single lady, 24 years old and supports her parents. She sells second hand clothing in Koibatek and has been in the business for a period of one year earning an income of 8,500 KES.

Sharleen has borrowed her first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase two bales of second hand clothing for resale. The anticipated amount will be used to improve living standards, increase her business assets and start the same business in a different location. Her dream is to venture into great investments in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar is a vigorous, 42-year-old married woman. For about six years she has been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in high demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to her family's income. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and pearls for embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater to her customers more consistently. She hopes to increase her income by completing her customers' orders on time. She is in her second loan cycle with Kashf Foundation.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and pearls for embellishment.

loans.name: Galilea Group

texts.es:
Galilea es un grupo integrado por 11 personas el cual se encuentra ubicado en Tres Valles y las principales actividades economicas son el cultivo de piña y caña de azúcar. 

Doña Isabel es uno de los integrantes del grupo, ella tiene la edad de 60 años, solo estudio primaria y actualmente esta soltera. Ella platica que antes de llegar a vivir a su comunidad, vivió una temporada en Villa Hermosa, Tabasco en donde decidió tomar un curso de belleza para montar su propia estética, durante el tiempo que vivió allá ejerció este oficio y cuando llego a vivir a Tres Valles decidió volver a montar su negocio ya que le gusta mucho esta actividad y por mas de 32 años ha sido su fuente de empleo, su negocio actualmente  esta ubicado en el centro y lo ha llamado como su nieta ya que espera que cuando ella falte su nieta continué con el negocio. Ademas de brindar el servicio como estilista en algunas temporadas organiza cursos para enseñar a nuevas jóvenes este oficio. 

Isabel esta muy contenta con su actividad porque la ayudado a salir adelante a través de estos años y espera poco a poco ganar mas clientes y seguir enseñando a mas personas su oficio.

El grupo Galilea agradece el apoyo que se le ha brindado con este crédito. 

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Agustin venta de zapatos
Eloisa venta de comida 
Angela venta de refrescos 
Candelaria venta de ropa 
Hortencia venta de manualidades 
Rosa Isela venta de ropa 
Maria del socorro venta de cosméticos 
Eusebia venta de ropa 
Maria cristina venta de zapatos
Sara Luz venta de calzado
texts.en:
Galilea is a group of 11 people located in Tres Valles whose main financial industries are growing pineapples and sugar cane.

Isabel is one of the members of the group. She is 60 years old. She only attended primary school and currently she is single. She says that before coming to live in the community she lived for a time in Villa Hermosa, Tabasco, where she decided to take a beauty course so she could open her own beauty salon. While she lived there she worked in this field and when she moved to Tres Valles she decided to open her business since she likes this activity very much and it has been her source of employment for more than 32 years.

Her business currently is located in the city center and is named for her granddaughter as she hopes to pass it on so the business survives. Besides providing stylist services she sometimes organizes courses for new students to the field.

Isabel is very happy in her work because it helped provide for her over the years and she has gained more customers little by little and is continuing teaching more people the craft.

Galilea is grateful for the support that has been provided through this loan.

The other members of the group are:

Agustin who sells shoes
Eloisa who sells food
Angela who sells soft drinks
Candelaria who sells clothing
Hortencia who sells handicrafts
Rosa Isela who sells clothing
Maria del Socorro who sells cosmetics
Eusebia who sells clothing
Maria Cristina who sells shoes
Sara Luz who sells shoes

loans.use: to buy scissors, hair dye, shampoo and to provide maintenance to the business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
"There are so many opportunities in America,” says Carlos. In 2010, Carlos moved from Peru to the United States with nothing but a piece of luggage and dreams to better his life

He came to America to study mechanics but could not find a job in his field and began working in a grocery store. After three years of balancing two full-time jobs as a maintenance employee, Carlos decided to use his mechanics education to start his own business "I've always loved fixing things. Getting the right pieces together and using tools". Carlos realized that most shopping carts in grocery stores are badly maintained, dirty, and often have broken parts. He saw an opportunity to put his mechanics skills, grocery store experience, and entrepreneurial spirit to the test and opened his own shopping cart maintenance business. 

Carlos negotiated with the grocery store management to hire him to service the hundreds of shopping carts in the store.  Carlos will start his business locally and he hopes that with the multiple connections he has made over the years as a grocery store employee, he can grow his business to service dozens of other grocery stores throughout Northern California. The loan will help Carlos purchase a power washer, a truck and other tools.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his shopping cart maintenance business.

loans.name: Marc Elysee

texts.en:
Marc is a 43-year-old entrepreneur from Ivory Coast, Cote d’Ivoire seeking the American Dream and giving his family a better life. Marc established a business called Excellent Prix Mini Market in December of 2011 in pursuit of that dream. Prior to opening the business, Marc struggled through much adversity. In one instance, a previous landlord of the retail location required Marc to prepay the rent for a full year. After being at the location for a few months, the landlord placed a condition to Marc requiring that his mini market only sell African food, otherwise they would not be allowed to retain the location. 

Without proper resources to secure a resolution, Marc left the location and the unused prepaid rent, for which he was entitled to receiving a reimbursement. Marc has moved on and has since secured a new location with a new landlord. He is now seeking a microloan to finance the store’s inventory.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his Excellent Prix Mini Market at his new location.

loans.name: Elise

texts.en:
Elise is very excited about the opportunity to provide her clients with expanded marketing and branding solutions for all of their business needs.  With over 20 years' experience and a network of clients that spans nationwide, it was time for Elise to take it to the next level in owning her own business.  

The challenge she faces is start-up capital for needed operating equipment like computers and software programs, marketing materials, contractor support, training and expenses to bridge the business until sales and orders are placed and start to come in.

The Kiva loan will solve her problem by allowing her to purchase the needed operating equipment, marketing materials, and contractor support and cover expenses until the sales orders start to come in.

With company profits, her plan is to continue to grow the company, hire additional employees and expand to a larger office.

loans.use: to purchase operation equipment such as compatible software systems, marketing materials and to cover expenses until the sale orders come in.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has had a business of hand embroidery for many years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the needs of the family members. Najma’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best-earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls of various colors in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 10,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so that she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for their tremendous support. She wishes to provide a good, quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a 36-year-old married mother of three, owns a school which she has run for 13 years in Nairobi. This will be her second loan term with KADET LTD; she plans to use the amount to buy a photocopier for her school. This will enable the school to print examination papers and other documents and hence save on the cost of outside printing. She will use the savings to buy more chairs, desks and stationery.

Mary hopes to buy a piece of land to construct more classrooms in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier for her school.

loans.name: Dilber

texts.en:
Dilber is a 44-year-old widow with 2 sons and 1 daughter. Dilber is a merchant in her hometown. She opened a clothing store near her home and is working to develop it into a steady business. She sells women's clothing that she gets from other cities. Her elder son helps her to sell clothes. 

Dilber is dedicated to seeing her business thrive, but she is taking only small steps to ensure that she does not expand too rapidly and incur large debts. Her profit from this business is 170 AZN for a month.

She wants to move her store into a major shopping center, so she is requesting a loan of 1900 AZN. Her good client history is proof of her ability to repay.

loans.use: to move her store into a major shopping center

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фагорат опытный садовод и жительница города Конибодом. Ей 46 лет. У нее есть муж и четверо детей. В настоящее время ее муж и двое сыновей находятся на заработках в России. Фарогат в течение 12 лет занимается садоводством. У нее есть небольшой сад, где растут абрикосовые деревья, за которыми ухаживает она сама. Фарогат каждый год со своей семьей собирает спелые абрикосы и сушит их на солнце во дворе своего дома. Затем сушеные абрикосы они выводят на продажу в местные рынки. Это является их довольно прибыльным семейным бизнесом. Сейчас Фарогат намерена расширить свой сад. Она просит кредит для закупа 50-60 саженцев абрикоса и минеральных удобрений. Фарогат надеется, что ее поддержат в осуществлении ее цели и заранее благодарит всех за поддержку.
texts.en: Farogat is an experienced gardener and resident of the city of Konibodom.  She is 46 years old, has a husband and four children.  At the present time, her husband and two sons are working in Russia.  Farogat has been involved in gardening for 12 years.  She has a small garden with apricot trees that she takes care of herself.  Every year, Farogat and her family pick ripe apricots and dry them in the sun in the yard of their house.  Then, they take dried apricots to local markets for sale.  This is a fairly profitable family business.  Currently, Farogat intends to expand her garden.  She is requesting this loan to purchase 50-60 seedlings of apricots and mineral fertilizers.  Farogat hopes that she will be supported in realizing her goal and thanks everyone for the support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings of apricots and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Lhagvadorj

texts.en:
Lhavgadorj is a 41-years-old single man living in the Ger Huvsgul province of Mongolia. He has been helping his parents for years with their shoes manufacturing small business at home. He has a lot of experience in the business. His parents tutored him and he is now well-known in town for his quality shoes and shoes repair. 

He is now starting his own business at home and requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of inventory to produce shoes to sell to local clients. He is a hardworking, helpful and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase large amount of inventory to produce shoes to sell to local clients.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 49 years old and she lives in Kapan with her big and nice family. Anush is married, and she has two sons and a daughter. Her elder son and daughter are married and live separately with their families; the youngest son is working abroad in the Russian Federation. 

Anush is trained as a geologist, but she has never done that work because she and her husband work in farming and agriculture in the village Tavrus.

On their farm they have two cows, two piglets, and twenty chickens. They also have a private piece of land where they cultivate potatoes and a beautiful orchard (apple, apricot, pear, and peach trees). In addition to their farm, they also work; Anush is a head of library of their village and her husband is a community manager. 

Anush is asking a loan to buy calves, some diesel fuel, and some money for the organization of harvest gathering.

loans.use: To buy calves, some diesel fuel, and to organize the harvest gathering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bales of second hand t-shirts for resale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a very charming woman who lives in a small flat in Getahovit village with her husband, son, and mother-in-law. She has a farm that she and her husband have enriched and enlarged through their hard work. Elena keeps pigs, chickens, and cows on the farm and also cultivates corn, greens, and different fruits. The harvest is sold locally to provide income for the family.

Elena is requesting this loan to purchase 7 calves and enlarge her farm. The loan is very important for her as she plans to get involved in dairy production. Elena hopes that Kiva lenders will help her to expand her agricultural business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 7 calves

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is one of many women who care for and bring up children alone, by working hard and through the many problems that can emerge in life. Her sons are grown; the elder son is an economist, and the younger serves in the army.

Armenuhi runs a little farming business. She is involved in beekeeping, and some limited land cultivation.  

As a result of working night and day, Armenuhi manages to get high quality honey and sell it to local resellers. Because of her kind attitude and tasty honey, there are many people in the area that prefer to purchase honey only from Armenuhi. 

Armenuhi needs financial support to increase her production of honey and meet her clients needs. She has applied for this loan to purchase 20 colonies of bees. The loan is very important for her to accomplish her goals and gather more income.

Aremnuhi waits for your support!

loans.use: to buy 20 colonies of bees.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab resides in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a fertile land situated at the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She is married and has three children. She has practiced farming for over twenty years. Her main sources of income are cash crops and horticultural crops.

She wants to venture into poultry farming and has thus requested a loan of 50,000 KES for purchasing poultry. This will add to her sources of income egg production and thus improve her family's living standards. In five years' time, she wants to have over 5,000 poultry layers and broilers. The challenge she faces is insufficient funds, pests and diseases. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for its processing of loans.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra
Tienda
C 300000
	Mayra vive en el Barrio 20 de Noviembre en Puntarenas, lugar de mucha pobreza y problemas sociales, tiene 48 años de edad y vive con su esposo y una  hija que estudia actualmente. Con el esfuerzo y trabajo  además del apoyo de Fundación Mujer desde hace más de 15 años ha logrado establecer una clientela para la venta de ropa y artículos personales, de forma ambulante, ha logrado dar estudio a sus hijas, adquirir otros bienes, y junto a su esposo que atiende una pequeña pulpería han logrado salir adelante. 
	El objetivo de este préstamo es comprar mercadería, como productos de principalmente ropa de temporada ya que se aproxima en Costa Rica la festividad del día de la madre, por lo que la oportunidad de variar el producto no se puede desaprovechar, situación que la clienta, por su experiencia y conocimiento del mercado realiza con anticipación. Mayra también perteneció al Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas que ha apoyado a otras mujeres con crédito para sus negocios, pero por el nivel que ella tiene requiere realizar una mayor inversión para su micro empresa.
Entre sus metas destaca salir adelante para su familia  tenga un futuro mejor, que puedan mejorar su calidad de vida  y apoyar a que su negocio crezca cada día más. Por ahora la dificultada más grande ha sido la económica, y en parte la competencia que le pueden hacer las personas que venden por catálogo, pero han encontrado en este programa un apoyo para su micro emprendimiento y por su experiencia ha logrado mantener una cartera de clientes activa y de muy buena moral de pago.
texts.en:
Mayra is requesting a loan for 300,000 Costa Rican colones.   She lives in the "20 de Noviembre" neighborhood of Puntarenas, a place with a lot of poverty and social problems.  She is 48 years old, and lives with her husband and daughter, who currently attends school.  With effort and hard work, and with the support of Fundacion Mujer for more than 15 years, Mayra has managed to establish a customer base for her business selling clothing and personal items, which she sells door-to door. She has managed to give her daughters an education, acquire other goods, and along with her husband, who tends to a small grocery store, they have managed to get ahead.  

The goal for this loan is to buy merchandise, mainly seasonal clothing, because in Costa Rica, Mother's Day is approaching (August 15), and so she doesn't want to miss the opportunity to change her products.  Because of her experience and knowledge of the market, this is something that her customers look forward to with anticipation.  

Mayra belongs to the communal bank "Mujer Creciendo Juntas," which has supported other women with loans for their businesses, but at her level, she needs to make a bigger investment in her small business.  

Among her goals, the one that stands out is to get ahead so that her family can have a better future and improve their quality of life.  She also wants to support her business so that it grows over time.  At this time, her greatest difficulty has been the economy, and also the competition from the people who sell from catalogs.  However, she has found support for her small business in this program, and with her experience she has managed to maintain a set of active customers who have good credit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 15 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good, quality food as well as clothing and good health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en: Hakim is an old man, aged 44 years. He has eight children and four additional dependents from his late brother, who died of typhoid four years ago.  All his children and dependents are in school, and they depend on him for all their needs.  Due to the family responsibilities, he resorted to large-scale  banana farming. Now he supplies nearby schools, and a hospital. The banana farming has made him able to afford to pay school fees for his children, and to look after the whole family. Through farming, he has also managed to begin building a permanent house. But the house is not yet finished, so he wants this loan of 4,000,000 UGX to complete the building of his house.

loans.use: To complete his house

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is a 32-year-old man who has applied for a loan of ugx.1,500,000. Asaph is married, with three children, two of whom attend school.  

His business is welding; he works eight hours a day, seven days a week. He does not have any other additional income, but his wife is a tailor and supplements her husband's income. 

His business is located on a busy street in Kizinda. He started the business to earn money to support his house hold, and to take care of his family. Asaph’s clients are people around town and from villages.  He faces competition from many other people who have enough capital to inject in their businesses.

He is going to buy a motorcycle to be used to transport people to different destinations for a fee; he will use the proceeds to pay tuition for his children.  He hopes that when his children finish their studies, that his business will grow, and to be in a position to construct a shelter for himself and his family (it has always been his dream to see his family living in a modest accommodation). 

He is very hardworking person who is committed to his business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.  Abeer is a married woman from Saida, a small village near Tulkarem.  She is a mother for three young daughters.  Her husband works as a blacksmith in his own workshop.  It is a profitable project that earns him a good income but is not enough for the family’s needs.

Abeer took a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help Abeer's husband to buy some heavy tools for his workshop.  This will develop it and help to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy some heavy tools for the workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 42-year-old married woman with four sons and two daughters. She lives in a small house in Jenin City. Her husband is a worker with a very low wage, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs. 

Hanadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new air conditioner which is very necessary in the summer, especially in Jenin City, because Jenin is very hot compared to the other cities in Palestine.

Hanadi and her son appear in the Kiva profile picture.

loans.use: to buy a new air condition for the family home.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera is a 35-year-old mother of four sons and two daughters. Sameera has a four-year-old business selling abayas and accessories. She now wants to include selling female tops and a new collection of accessories, and for that she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to include selling female tops and a new collection of accessories in her business.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en: Hamzeh is a 21-year-old single guy, the second oldest brother in his family. Hamzeh is working hard to get his bachelor's degree from the university, but he recently faced a shortage in his finances, so he has applied for this educational loan to pay for the next semester's registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for the next semester's registration fees.

loans.name: Maa Gayatri Group

texts.en:
In the year 2009 five active ladies from the weaving community in a rural village called Tukla of Nuapada district of Odisha, India formed a Joint Liability Group named Maa Gayatri with an intention to expand their existing business by taking a loan from the Mahashakti Foundation. Anusuya, the energetic lady of 40 years sitting second from right with raised hand, is one of them. She is very active and always cheerful. Her family consists of her husband, one son aged seventeen, and three daughters aged twenty-five, twenty-three and twenty.

From last twenty five years Anusuya is running a cloth vending business with the help and support of her husband.As this is their traditional business, her husband was already doing this business before her marriage. After marriage both of them are managing the business. She purchases saris from the local market and from the weavers of her village and brings the ready-made garments from a wholesale market 200 kilometers away. Her husband moves to different villages and weekly markets on a bike for selling saris and garments. 

She earns a monthly income of 8,000 Indian Rupees (INR) from her existing business, but that is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her six-member family. So Anusuya wants to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business. Looking into the coming festive season, from the present loan she is planning to purchase some quality saris and fancy garments for selling. Anusuya assumes that this will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. Anusuya has a dream to save enough money for the marriage of her daughters in a respectable manner.

The other three members of the group are Sanjuta with Tiffin business and Saraswati and Sindhu with cloth vending business.

loans.use: To buy quality saris and fancy garments for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su madre ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como secretaria en una empresa privada por mas de ocho horas al día ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de sus estudios ya que con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para pagarlos.
El sueño de María, es terminar sus estudios y mejorar sus ingresos para poder independizarse ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
María is single and doesn’t have children. She lives in her mother’s one-room house with brick walls and a dirt floor. The house is in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz.

Currently she works as a secretary in a private company for more than eight hours a day because she has to use what she earns to cover the cost of food and basic utilities for her family.

She needs the loan to pay for her studies, since she cannot afford to pay for them with the little she earns.

María’s dream is to finish her studies and improve her income so that she can become independent, because she wants to improve her quality of life.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for university studies.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 26 years old and single. He sells and supplies cakes in Nairobi and its neighboring areas. He has been in this business for the past three years and he currently makes a monthly income of 21,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings).

This will be his second loan term with KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan amount to make more cakes to sell. He also plans to set up a bakery for making cakes and bread. He will use the anticipated income to save and later buy a pick-up for supplying cakes.

He hopes to become successful in his business, make more income, and be able to further his education.

loans.use: to set up a bakery and buy more cake to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food production business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Lilia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 52-year-old married woman who has four children. Corazon and her husband are farmers who live in the town of Alcala. They plant and harvest corn to sell. Corazon also hires additional laborers who help them in the farming business. The couple also serves as barangay (village) officials in their community. 

Corazon hopes to improve crop growth and decided to borrow a loan of PHP 40,000 to invest in the cornfield. She will buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in corn farming.

With enough farm inputs, Corazon will harvest crops profitably and gain good profits for her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in corn farming.

loans.name: Ma. Cecile

texts.en:
This time, for her fifth cycle loan from NWTF, Ma. Cecile is applying for a new loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her rice field.  

The general store business that was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide for her and her family to increase their income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Víctor Julio

texts.es: Víctor Julio, tiene la edad  de 60 años, está casado, vive con su hijo y esposa que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos adecuados para el café, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo de la variedad más adecuada para la zona y hacer una buena resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Víctor Julio is sixty years old and lives with his wife and son, who are his main priority.  He intends to use this loan to purchase organic fertilizers and fungicides that are appropriate for his coffee crops, as well as to pay laborers to assist him with his crops.  He also plans to buy seedlings of the variety that are most suitable for his area and carefully replant these at the start of the rainy season, with the goal of increasing the density of these plants.  Further, he wants to take advantage of the fertile soil, climate and other conditions that are favorable for the production of coffee.

With these improvements he hopes to be able to obtain a little bit of profit and thus improve conditions for his family.  He also wishes to invest a little more in his fields and to be able to complete some additional goals.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not previously had loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has brought him this loan with greater ease and at a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to take care of his coffee crops.

loans.name: Shafeela

texts.en:
Shafeela is a 29-year-old married woman. She has three children; all are going to school. She is happily running a small general store at the corner of her house where she offers various types of products such as bangles and handicrafts to the people of her community. 

Her business is at its initial stage and she wants to expand her business. So, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more products such as dozens of bangles with different colors and designs as well as some decorative pieces to inflate her sales. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wishes to spend part of the revenue to deal with the expenses of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more products such as dozens of bangles with different colors and designs as well as some decorative pieces.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 21-year-old married woman. She has two children, one daughter and one son. She is striving hard to meet her family's demands, including food, clothing, and healthcare. Her husband is employed in a small factory but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditure of the family. So she started her business to contribute to the family income. 

She has been in the business of sewing for many years; she is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of the Kashf foundation. She took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors with some packs of buttons and needles, in order to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving good quality education to her children through all of her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with some packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband worked alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household with the educational needs of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has now requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to consistently meet increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Perveen hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: To support her family, Delia makes snacks for sale. She has been managing this business as an additional source of income for three years. She believes that much patience is needed in performing this service, because different processes are required to make “bibingka” and other native cakes. She wants to increase her production to provide her family with a higher income but, unfortunately, her lack of capital is holding her back. Delia is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to enable her to buy milk, malagkit rice and sugar, to make malagkit (sticky rice) for snacks.

loans.use: to purchase milk, malagkit rice and sugar to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 51 years old, widowed, and supports a family of five. She is small-scale dairy farmer, as well as a milk trader in the Chemundu center, which is served by KADET LTD’s Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the last four years. She earns an average monthly income of KES 6,000. She plans to use the loan amount of KES 30,000 to buy more milk for resale. Her dream is to educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Elsie

texts.en: Ma. Elsie is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Ma. Elsie runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she sells a variety of items, such as alcohol, soft drinks and groceries. Ma. Elsie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 57 years old, married, and has three children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Merlita applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been growing rice for twelve years and has borrowed from NWTF 17 times in the past, more recently with Kiva’s support. In the future, Merlita would like to save money to expand her business and buy farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is an Iraqi client. He is 40 years old, married and the father of 4 children. Jamil works hard to provide his family's income. He sells spare parts for cars in his shop. Before establishing his business in 2007, Jamil used to work as an employee at a garage for several years. After gaining much experience in this field and a knowledge of spare parts, he decided to use his marketing skills and establish his own business. Jamil has gained an excellent reputation in the market thanks to his competitive prices.

Jamil is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to install ceramic blocks on the floor and on the walls of his shop. Jamil is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to install ceramic blocks on the floor and on the walls of his shop

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat, age 24, is a married woman. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by doing machine-embroidery business. She has been doing it for the past two years. She knows the techniques of stitching and embroidery very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of pearls and sequins. The loan will help her meet the orders of her customers on time. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of pearls and sequins.

loans.name: José Ramiro

texts.es: José Ramiro, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes que le den un buen resultado en el cultivo de café, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas con un buen desarrollo y sanidad de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Ramiro is 20 years old and single.  He lives with his parents and siblings, and they are his greatest priority.  He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizers to get a good result with his coffee crop and to buy fungicides.  He will also pay for the labor and care of the coffee.  In addition, he will buy some plants that are well-developed and healthy for the seedling nursery in order to replant when the rains start.  

His objective for doing so is to increase the density of plants in the area.  He will also take advantage of the good, fertile soil, the climate, and other conditions that are favorable for growing coffee.  With these crop improvements, he hopes to get a little profit and, in this way, improve his family’s living conditions.  He will also invest a little more in the area that he cultivates and fulfill some goals.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous loan with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy what he needs for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Rasheed

texts.en:
Rasheed is a 34-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He lives in a simple home in the city with his wife and two children; a son and a daughter.

Rasheed works as an employee in the public sector with a low wage that barely covers the family needs. but it is stable somehow. 

Rasheed would like to buy a washing machine because he did not have one before.  Buying a washing machine will improve his family's living conditions and make it easier.

Rasheed requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a new washing machine for the family home.

Rasheed appears in the photo as he was purchasing the new washing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new washing machine for the family home.

loans.name: Mishell

texts.en: Mishell is 24 years old and married to Cornelius, and they are blessed with two children, 3 and 7. She has been in the milk-selling business, as well as doing small-scale dairy farming, for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. She operates her business in the Kapyagan Chemundu trading center. She has borrowed KES 30,000 and plans to use part of it to buy more milk for resale and the remainder to set up a zero grazing pen. She will use the profits from the milk trade to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, 46 years old, is married to a farmer and blessed with four children. She owns and manages a vegetable-vending business at the public market. In this business, she earns a net income of PHP 2,000 per day. She decided to take out a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy tomatoes, cabbages, carrots and squash to sell. She's hoping that her business will become more profitable and improve enough to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cabbages, carrots and squash to sell.

loans.name: Ninia

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Ninia works hard to support her family. She has a business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food-vending and a coffee shop. Ninia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. Ninia has been maintaining her business activities with her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shalemar

texts.en: Shalemar is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell at her food stall. She has been in this business for four years. Shalemar earns additional income from selling dry goods. She has been maintaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a hard-working entrepreneur who sell spare vehicle parts in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional spare parts to sell. Maricel has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Maricel has been maintaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare vehicle parts to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
At the age of 34, Razia is an energetic married woman. She has been doing a business of making artificial flowers for the past five years. She offers various handmade artificial flowers in different colors which are used in decorating homes and rooms. By this time, she has become famous in providing good-quality colorful flowers in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. 

Razia has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her second loan cycle and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. This will help her to purchase raw material, including various types of fabrics such as silk and cotton, along with packs of glue and wires. In this way, she would be able to get an increase in her earnings through her large sales.

loans.use: to purchase raw material, including various types of fabrics such as silk and cotton, along with packs of glue and wires.

loans.name: Ami De Jesus Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATOU représente le groupe   AMIS DE JESUS. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend du charbon, du bois de chauffe et des pagnes dentelles depuis1998. Elle s’approvisionne par livraison à domicile pour le bois, à Léo pour le charbon et chez les grossistes en ville pour les pagnes. Ses clients sont les voisins, amis et revendeur.
Mme veut s’acheter 05 rangés et 18 sacs de charbon de bois.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne  devenir une grande vendeuse en descendant des camions de bois  et aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Aminatou represents the Amis de Jesus group. Married, she is a mother of five children. Her oldest child is 22 years old, while her youngest is a one year old. Three of the children go to school. She has three [other] people under her care. 

She has been selling charcoal, fire wood, and lace pagne cloth since 1998. The wood is delivered to her house. And she procures the charcoal from the town of Leo and the pagnes from wholesalers in town. Her customers are her neighbors, friends, and retailers. 

She wants to buy five rows [of firewood] and 18 bags of charcoal. With her earnings, she wants to reinvest in her business. She hopes to become a large seller by having her own supply of wood brought down by trucks and helping her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy five rows [of firewood] and 18 sacs of charcoal

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en: Bajram is 62, married, and has only one son. He lives with his family in a Roma community in the southern part of Kosovo. Bajram works for the electric company and is a very hard-working man, dedicating himself to his work fully and trying to make a living for his family. His wife is a housewife, staying at home to care for the house and the family affairs. Bajram has managed to build a house, but he has not been able to finish the bathroom. He is applying for a loan to complete the construction and renovation of the toilet, which is in urgent need of repair and is unsanitary and unhealthy in its current condition. He hopes in the future to have a better a life and to save money for his future. He is very grateful for this opportunity to improve his living conditions, and he is appreciative to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to rebuild and improve a bathroom.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 32-year-old lady and a mother of four children. She started her own business of a general store three years ago, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to support the needs of the family members alone. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothes and education. 

Tahira offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. To purchase more items for her store, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of Rs. 25,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en:
Meldred is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Meldred is 27 years old and one of her children is in school.

Meldred has a fishing business in the Philippines. Meldred requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and tools for fishing.

Meldred has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Meldred would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools for fishing

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 44-year-old widow. She has been successfully running a small general store in the corner of her house; she has five years of experience in this field.  

She offers various types of good quality grocery items for daily use. Her daughter also assists her by purchasing goods from the market, as she has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Riffat wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She also wishes to spend part of the profits on the arrangement of her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Saber

texts.en:
Saber is a 27-year-old single man. He lives alone in a small house in Rafah city. Saber works as an employee and gets a low income. 
Saber took a 650 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his personal use. Saber will be able to work and do some reports while he is at home and also read articles and news on the internet. This will improve his performance at work and also improve his knowledge.
Saber appears in the KIVA profile photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his personal use

loans.name: Mamadou Laminegueye Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de 20 femmes fait parti du Banc Villageois qui a été crée 04/05/2009.Elles habitent le même quartier. Elles pratiquent pour la plupart comme activité le commerce. Debout à droite et levant la main, Fatou, est la représentante du groupe/ Elle est âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle fait comme activité Le commerce de produit cosmétiques.  Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter  des chaussures, des sacs, et des produits cosmétiques.  Les bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer l’épargne.
texts.en:
This group of 20 women is part of the Banc Villageois created on May 4, 2009.  All the members of the group live in the same neighborhood and most of them are involved in retail business.

Fatou, the group's representative, is the woman standing on the right-hand side and raising her hand.  She is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three children including two boys.  She sells cosmetic products.

She will use her loan to buy shoes, handbags and cosmetic products.  With her profits, she will be able to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy shoes, handbags and cosmetic products

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Le  banc villageois abritant ce groupe a été depuis 02/08/2008. Ledit groupe est composé de six femmes issues du même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales s'activant dans le commerce. Le groupe est à son 10 prêt.
Khady est une femme veuve âgée de 45 ans et mère de 3 filles de 35 ans ,32 , 30 et 1 garçon de 21 ans.
Elle est la représente du groupe.Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus et objets d'art.
Avec son nouveau crédit 400000 elle va se payer des rouleaux de tissus des bracelets et du thé et du sucre qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de sa boutique.
Elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans son domaine .Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins familiales et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois that hosts this group was formed 02/08/2008. Said group is composed of six women from the same village who are united by good social relations and who are active merchants. The group is on its tenth loan cycle.

Khady is a 45 year old widow and mother of three girls aged 35, 32, and 30, and one boy aged 21 years. She is the representative of the group. Khady is active in the trade of fabrics and art objects. With her new loan of 400,000 XOF, she plans to purchase rolls of fabric, bracelets, tea and sugar that she will retail at her shop on Joal road. Khady benefits from good experience in her field. The income she earns will allow her to pay for the family's daily needs and to increase her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of fabric, bracelets, tea and sugar that she will sell at her shop

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora, habita en la Comarca San Agustín, es docente desde hace muchos años, es casada, madre de dos hijos que van a la escuela, el esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, el se dedica a la agricultura. Doña Auxiliadora solicita el crédito porque necesita repellar las paredes de su vivienda y así ir mejorando su humilde hogar y brindarle buenas condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora lives in the San Agustín region. She has been a teacher for many years. She is a married mother of two schoolchildren. Her husband, a farmer, helps her with the household costs. Auxiliadora is requesting this loan because she needs to re-plaster the walls of her home and improve her humble home. This will provide her family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ailyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ailyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Ailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Benkadi sont en majorité mariée  dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Missira à Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage et surtout leur activité génératrice de revenu. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de mèche, de pommade des rouges à lèvre, des robes et des parfums.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fanta (1ère femme débout de la gauche vers la droite dans la  photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des mèches, pommades, des rouges à lèvre de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter plusieurs paquets de mèche, des boites de pommade et crème à lèvre. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile, au marché et en ambulant à  une clientèle composée de femmes. Madame Fanta  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité pour agrandir son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group "Benkadi" are married for the most part in monogamous families. The women average 32 years of age and four children each, all living in the Missira district in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and especially their revenue-generating businesses. The group members work in small-scale commerce involving hair extensions, ointments, lipstick, dresses, and perfumes. 

With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Fanta, (first woman standing from the left in the photo) has a great reputation for selling hair extension, ointments, and lipstick of all kinds. She intends to use her loan to purchase several packets of hair extensions, containers of ointment, and lipgloss. Sales are made in cash or on credit at the market and by going door to door. Her customer base is composed of women. 

With this loan, Ms. Fanta hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase ointments, hair extensions, and other products to sell

loans.name: Djekafo  5 Group

texts.fr:
Les  huit  femmes  de Djekafo 5 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Hawa.d  (dernière femme debout à droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Sirakorobougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The eight women of "Djekafo 5" are all married in traditional families, and they average 32 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Sirakorobougopu, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their seasonal farmwork and by ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

With the goal of purchasing various equipment and stocking up on farm inputs, the group members found out about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third farm loan cycle.

Ms. Hawa.d (last woman standing at the right in the photo) is a great seasonal farmwork leader in the village of Sirakorobougou. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, purchase seeds and manure, and then pay youngsters to weed her field. Sales of her produce are made in cash at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan, and finally to have revenues to provide for the children and some for the family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and sundry equipment

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: Silvia una joven madre emprendedora, ella es  integrante del grupo “Las Tres Marías” conformada por 06 mujeres luchadoras que buscan cada día mejorar, con el único propósito de velar por el bienestar de sus familias. Hace más de 03 años que Silvia se dedica a la venta de juguetes y prendas de vestir para niños. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Silva  ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo y mejorar su negocio. Más adelante le gustaría poner su panadería, pues tiene conocimientos sobre ello. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicito el crédito para la compra de ropa de temporada como pantalones, casacas y chompas. Silvia de 26 años es separada y tiene 01 hijo mejor de edad. El grupo “Las Tres Marías” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Silvia está de pie, es la primera del lado derecho viste chompa color ploma y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Silvia is a young enterprising mother. She is a member of the “Las Tres Marías” ["The Three Marias"] group, made up of six hard-working women who are looking to improve every day. Their sole goal is to ensure their families' well-being. Silvia has sold toys and children's clothing for over three years. With great hard work and dedication, Silvia has been able to get her child ahead and improve her business. In the future, she would like to open a bakery as she has knowledge in this area. With the goal of continuing to improve, she requested this loan for the purchase of seasonal clothing such as pants, dress coats, and sweaters. Silvia is 26 and separated. She has one young child. The "Las Tres Marias" group thanks those who will make this loan possible.
