Allí se dedica al comercio de ropa, accesorios y artesanías en general, desde hace 2 años, cuando en el mes de Diciembre del año 2010, compró sus primeros calzados, accesorios y vestidos para venderle  a sus primeros  clientes, que poco a poco han ido recomendándole a otros, y ella con su buen servicio,  los ha convertido en sus fieles compradores. Desiré,  diariamente desde muy temprano, compra la mercancía a mayoristas del mercado, la clasifica y de acuerdo con el pedido responde a su clientela, mientras que sus compras   a minoristas,  las hace de acuerdo a las especificaciones y los pedidos que le hayan hecho. Ella vende de contado y a crédito, a sus clientes y estos a su vez, le pagan poco a poco cada producto. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio local comercial y sacar adelante a su hija, dejándole su propio negocio. En la actualidad Desiré está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara productos artesanales, calzado y vestidos encargados por sus buenos clientes; ella espera recibir su credikiva para ser muy oportuna en su respuesta, porque su sueño es lograr reconocimiento a nivel comercial, esforzándose al máximo para hacer avanzar su negocio y esto es justamente el éxito de Kiva.
texts.en:
Desiré is 31 years old and lives in a city very close to the capital of Atlántico.  There, she works selling clothes, accessories, and general handcrafts.  Two years ago (December of 2010), she bought her first shoes, accessories, and clothing to sell to her first customers.  Little by little, they have been recommending her to others and she has made them her faithful customers due to her good service.

Desiré wakes up early every day, buys her goods wholesale in the market, sorts it, and responds to her customers based on her orders.  She sells retail according to the specifications and orders that have been made to her.  She accepts cash and also sells on credit, accepting payment little buy little for each good.

Her goal for the future is to have her own store and help her daughter progress, leaving her with her own business.

Currently, Desiré is asking for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  With the loan, she will buy the handcrafts, shoes, and clothing that her good customers ask for.    She hopes to receive her Kiva loan and respond to it appropriately, because her dream is to obtain recognition in sales and do her best to help her business progress.  This is exactly what makes Kiva great.

loans.use: buy handcrafts, shoes, and clothing.

loans.name: Flores Marie

texts.en:
Flores Marie is 28 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Flores Marie is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her business.

Flores Marie has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from vegetable vending and furniture making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda tiene 37 años, está separada y vive en la casa de su hermana junta sus dos hijos. Florinda se dedica a la venta de comida como regionales, trabaja de lunes a viernes por las noches en la esquina de su barrio en donde diariamente instala una mesa y algunas sillas. Atiende siempre muy amablemente a sus clientes por lo que ha logrado tener buena acogida y demanda. Le gusta cocinar pues aprendió de su madre los secretos culinarios. Realiza este negocio desde hace 16 años contando y cuenta con la ayuda de su madre y desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus mesas y sillas donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en sus metas.  Se compromete a ser una socia puntual con cada uno de sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, condimentos, carnes, aceites, entre otros para su restaurante.
texts.en: Florinda is 37 years old, separated, and lives in her sister's house along with her two children. Florinda sells traditional regional dishes. She works Monday through Friday evenings on the corner of her neighborhood where she sets up a table and chairs daily. She is friendly with her customers so she has been able to establish a welcoming environment and customer base. She likes to cook, she learned her mother's culinary secrets. She has been doing this business for 16 years and depends on her mother's help. She wishes to expand her business and improve her tables and chairs so she can make her customers more comfortable. She is seeking S/.2000, and is content to know that she has the economic support to continue forward to meet her goals. She promises to be punctual with every one of her payments. With the loan she will purchase rice, condiments, meat, oil, and other items for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy rice, condiments, meat and other items for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 50s, is married with four children who are all grown up.  She has five grandchildren and three of them go to school.  The other two are small.  She has been running a business of tie and dye for three years now.  She works from 8 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Mariam's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start making and selling tie and dye clothes called Vikoye.  Previously, she used to sell cooked food.  She is doing very well and is happy with the loan, which enables her to be self sufficient.  She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees for her three grandkids and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy more rolls of materials and different type of colors for her tie and dye business.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "CRANE", which has 13. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of materials and different types of colors for her tie and dye business.

loans.name: Los Progresistas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PROGRESISTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Ingrid ella es soltera y tiene 26 años; La socia altera sus actividades diarias trabajando en una institución pública, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando para esta institución el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatos para dama para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de agencia de viajes, venta de accesorios de celulares, transporte de carga, trabajadores para el sector publico,guia de turismo.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the communal bank "Los Progresistas" (The Progressives).  This bank is located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Ingrid is a group member, is single, and is 26 years old.  She alternates working in public service and in another field.  She has been working in public service for a while and it has been going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts towards her work every day.  At the same time, she works selling shoes via catalog.  In this way, she is able to get ahead.

Ingrid is asking for a loan to buy women's shoes for her business.

The other group members work selling cell phone accessories, transporting goods, in the public sector, as a travel agent, and as a tour guide.

The group members who are in the attached photo asked permission to arrive at the meeting late due to work.

Ingrid is thankful to those that are a part of this dream in this way and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: buy women's shoes.

loans.name: Frediswinda

texts.en:
Frediswinda is 64 years old and married with one child.
,
Frediswinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, eggs, charcoal, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Frediswinda has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Frediswinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, eggs, charcoal, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 66 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser amable y cordial.  Esta casada con Uderico, tiene 03 hijos de 25, 23 y 18 quienes ya son independientes, por eso vive solo con su esposo en su casa propia. Dora se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas para eso cuenta con un refrigeradora y un pequeño local  en el interior su vivienda, además de acondicionar el ambiente con música selecta y agradable al gusto de sus clientes, donde atiende a sus clientes de una manera amable y cordial. Le gustan su oficio ya que le permiten estar ocupada  y tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos personales. Este es su séptimo crédito con Kiva y se siente contenta por contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, por cajas y al por mayor.
texts.en:
Dora is 66 years old, is very hardworking, and has a great desire to progress.  In addition, she is kind and friendly.  She is married to Uderico and has 3 children (ages 25, 23, and 18) who are independent.  For this reason, she lives alone with her husband in their own house.  Dora works selling soft drinks.  For this, she has a refrigerator and a small shop in her house.  In addition to adjusting the atmosphere with select, pleasing music to make her customers happy, she assists her customers in a friendly and kind manner.  She likes her work because it allows her to be busy and have an income to help cover her personal expenses.

This is her 7th Kiva loan and she is happy to have a line of credit to use to advance her business.  In addition, she promises to make her payments on time.  With the amount asked for, she will buy soft drinks of various brands and appearances.  She will buy by the box and via wholesale.

loans.use: Compra de bebidas gasificadas.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 44 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, snack foods, candies, noodles, eggs and other groceries in her general store.

Evangeline has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, snack foods, candies, noodles, eggs and other groceries. 

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, snack foods, candies, noodles, eggs and other groceries

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 55 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Glenda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and seeds for her vegetable farm.

Glenda has been farming vegetables for six years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Murman

texts.en:
Murman is 53 years old. He lives in the small village of Sachkhere District with his wife and 20-year-old son. Murman has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Murman is an artisan and works on private orders to renovate houses. Additionally, he is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two pigs and sells piglets. The income is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Murman has now requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Murman has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Murman will purchase a stock of groceries and open a grocery shop. As the shop is opened, his wife will work as a saleslady and they both will do their best to increase the income of their family. Part of the income will be reinvested in the business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries and open a grocery shop

loans.name: Jali

texts.en:
Jali lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has eight children, the youngest being two years old. Her activities for the last three years have been buying fish, frying and then selling the fried fish to her customers. She also has a small retail shop that she operates for extra income. 

Jali knew Milango through friends, and since she wanted to be financed she joined the group of women in participating with Milango. She now seeks a loan to buy 10 kilograms of fish to add to her stock. The 47-year-old mother has ambitions of owning a wholesale shop in five years time. The major challenge that she faces is bad debts. Some of her customers are from the neighborhood and sometimes may not pay back in time for her business to improve. Jani wants to educate her children to the highest level they can go and also to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: a loan to buy 10 kilograms of fish

loans.name: Raouche Group

texts.en:
Raouche is a group composed of five Filipino ladies working as housekeepers for Lebanese families. Raquel is the leader and featured member of the group. She is a 40-year-old divorced mother of one child, standing on the left in the picture. Her child lives with Raquel's parents back in the Philippines, and she is the only financial provider of her family. Her low income can barely suffice for one person, which is why she decided to join the group and acquire a loan from Al Majmoua. It would help her settle the schooling tuition fees of her child.

As for the other group members, Imelda is standing in the center in the picture, Erlinda on the far right in the picture, Jennylyn second on the right in the picture, and Martina second to the left in the picture.

loans.use: to settle the schooling tuition fees of her child

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has 4 children and has been doing this work for 14 years. His primary income sources are milk and tea.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "returns gotten from farming." His biggest challenges are "animal pests and diseases." 

Benard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "it offers grace period." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and replied, "grace period offered to farmers."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, "how will this loan benefit his family," Benard replied, "better living standards."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Benard owns the following: "cow, bicycle," but does not own "pig, poultry, pump, motorcycle, or automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: "mosquito net, electricity, TV," but does not have "solar power, running water, sewing machine, or DVD player."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Purevsuren, 41 years old, lives with her 75-year-old mother, husband, two-year-old child, and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her mother has retired from work and gets a pension from the state. Her sister has been working as a manager at a photo studio for eight months. Her husband does building work on his own for a living. She herself has been working at the train station for twenty years and is considered to be the best worker by her colleagues. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, metals, fiberglass, foam, and a low pressure heater. Using those materials, her husband can make repairs and insulate their house, thus providing more comfortable and warmer accommodations for the whole family. 

The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, thus releasing less pollutants into the air, which contributes to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is from the village of Calaccab, Angadanan. He is 42 years old and married. To support his family, Alexander is busy managing their hog raising business. He has been in this business for five years. Right now, Alexander is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to buy hog feed and vaccine to sustain the proper growth of his livestock business. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccine to sustain the proper growth of his livestock business

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando, 43 years of age, is married, and they blessed with three children. He has managed a corn farming business for almost 17 years. Last cropping, his net income was 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). He wanted to seek a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can able to utilize it in his agricultural businesses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Jose Mathias

texts.es: El Sr. José es casado, su esposa se dedica al comercio en un cafetín, ambos procrearon tres hijos que dependen de ellos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando.  El trabaja como conductor de vehículo pesado para la municipalidad de Juigalpa. Solicita este crédito para hacerle mejoras en su hogar, cambiar el techo en el área de los dormitorios ya que actualmente está en mal estado. Con este logro su familia contara con un hogar más cómodo, con mejores condiciones y sobre todo seguridad.
texts.en: José is married and his wife runs a coffee shop.  They have three children in their care who attend school.  He works as a heavy vehicle driver for the municipality of Juigalpa and is requesting a loan to renovate his home.  José will install new roofing over the bedrooms because the current roof is in disrepair.  With this goal he wants to make the home more comfortable, safer and in better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and boards.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene años, está y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y uno de sus hijos. Olga se dedica a la crianza de pollos de granja, para eso cuenta con un pequeño galpón con capacidad máxima de 150 pollos, donde los cría hasta que consigan el peso ideal para venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene éste producto, por ser de consumo masivo en la alimentación diaria de la población. Le gusta su actividad porque puede sentirse una mujer productiva. Ahora quiere realizar algunos arreglos y  construir un pequeño galpón en el primer piso de su casa, con una capacidad de 200 pollos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su negocio, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. Con el monto solicitado comprará viruta para el piso de los pollos bebes y alimento para aves.
texts.en:
For several years Olga has lived in her own house with her husband and children.  She raises chickens and has a small shed with a maximum capacity of 150 chickens.  She raises them until they reach the ideal weight then sells them at the city market.  She considers it to be a profitable business due to the high demand of this product and its daily consumption among the population.  She enjoys her work because she feels productive.

Now she wants to make a few repairs and build a small shed on the ground level of her home to house 200 chickens.  On this occasion, she is requesting 2,000 PEN and is very grateful to those who will back her financially so she can continue her business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and will use it to buy sawdust for the shed for the baby chicks and poultry feed.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and sawdust for the shed.

loans.name: Jackelin

texts.es: Jackelin, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y cordial con las personas. Está casada con Justo quien es técnico enfermero y padre de su único hijo. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su casa propia. Jackelin es dentista, por eso construyó un loca en el interior de su vivienda donde instalo una botica y una clínica dental, atendiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes ofreciéndoles promociones por sus preferencias, de esa manera está haciendo crecer su cartera de clientes. Se inició hace más de 05 años con un capital propio y con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda a atender a sus clientes. Antes de comenzar con éste negocio no contaba con  ingresos propios y solo se dedicaba a estudiar, y con el apoyo de su pareja se decidió a empezar su negocio con los deseos de ser una prospera empresaria y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Este es su séptimo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles comprará implementos y materiales para su clínica dental tales como alcohol, algodón, pinzas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Jackelin, 31, is a hard-working, determined woman who is both cheerful and kind to people.  She is married to Justo who is a nursing technician and father of their only son.  Together they live comfortqably in their own home.  Jackelin is a dentist and runs a clinic from home where she also sells dental supplies.  She is kind to her customers and offers them promotions of her favorite products so her customer base has grown.

She started her business with her own capital over five years ago and her husband helps her attend to the customers.  Before beginning the business she did not have her own income as she was studying.  With the support of her husband she decided to become a successful entrepreneur and help with household expenses.  This is her seventh loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to get ahead.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and will use the 1,500 PEN to buy dental supplies such as alcohol, cotton, tweezers, etc.

loans.use: To buy dental supplies such as alcohol, cotton, tweezers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, cooking oil, assorted biscuits, shampoo, detergent soap, and ingredients for her general store

loans.name: Normanita

texts.en:
Normanita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc., for her food vending business.

Normanita has been in this business for 25 years. Normanita earns more income from buying and selling dried fish and from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Normanita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. He has two children and has been doing agricultural work for 18 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Coffee farming because it has higher returns." His biggest challenge is "high input prices." One animal on the farm has been given the name Wambura.

Jeremiah was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Because Juhudi is offering loans to farmers." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. "Microfinance helps farmers in groups," he responded.

His highest monthly expense is business related. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Jeremiah replied, "[I] shall be able to provide for their needs and pay school fees for the children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jeremiah owns a cow, poultry, a pump, and a bicycle, but does not own  a pig, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito netting, electricity, running water, TV, and DVD, but does not have solar power or sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 48 years old and married with four children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elena has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

Elena aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a school supplies business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of school supplies to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for 25 years. Thelma earns more income from buying and selling dry goods.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Chanthun

texts.en:
Chanthun is 29 years old. He is married and resides with a two-year-old child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is a photographer. He makes an income of $12 daily. His wife stays home and looks after her child. 

In order to improve his business, Chanthun is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a printer to use for printing pictures for his customers. This purchase will help him generate more income for the family. In the future, he would like to take another loan from KREDIT to improve his house and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a printer to use for printing picture for his clients

loans.name: Srey Man

texts.en:
Srey Man is 27 years old. She is married and resides with a child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Her husband runs the public transportation service. He earns about $20 daily. 

Due to lack of funds, Srey Man is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to build a fence around her house. This money will help her provide more security for her family. In the future, she would like to run grocery store at home and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a fence around her house

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 53 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger district full of traditional Mongolian gers (portable felt dwellings) and low quality houses. She has been working as a cook at restaurant for 12 consecutive years and has  accumulated vast amount of experience in preparing and flavoring lunch, dinner and breakfast. Her husband specializes in driving various types of automobiles and works for private business company. 

Using her previous loan, she purchased building materials in order to repair and insulate her house. Now she is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase additional building materials in order to make an extension to her house. Making the extension will reduce their coal consumption, thus releasing less pollutants to the atmosphere and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. In Mongolia, air pollution is one of the biggest environmental issue, and having high quality house is the best way of reducing carbon dioxide in the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional building materials in order to make extension on her house

loans.name: Sumber Rejeki Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Rejeki group is located at Sumberkima village, north Bali. The group consist of five women who have a similar business: small kiosks. They formed into a group to borrow a loan from MUK, share information and have a training from MUK’s FO.

Mariam, the head of the group, has two children. One of her children is still in school. Mariam has a small kiosk in front of her house. She needs a loan to purchase more merchandise such as shampoo, oil, soap, rice and other daily needs. She wants to improve her bussines. She has many customers around her neighborhood. She hopes she can earn more profit. She plan to save all the profit to support her children education.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her small kiosk.

loans.name: Damas Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Vilma es miembro de la alcancía Damas  Triunfadoras 
La alcancía está conformada por 06 socias, una de ellas es la Sra. Vilma de 33 años,  casada con 02 hijos que son estudiantes. Vilma trabaja en el negocio familiar que tiene junto a su esposo, ambos trabajan con la finalidad de darles a sus hijos una mejor educación, hace algunos años iniciaron su negocio de llantería y lavadero de carros. Vilma se encarga de brindarles una buena atención a sus clientes, que en su mayoría  son taxistas y choferes de empresas de transporte, gracias a su carisma los clientes que acuden a su negocio se sienten satisfechos, ella esta orgullosa de su negocio y verlo prosperar cada día es su mayor felicidad, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y accesorios para carros. En el futuro desea seguir creciendo y poder abrir otra sucursal. Vilma quiere agradecer por este préstamo a los inversionistas de KIVA que confían en ella y su grupo comunal.
*Vilma es la cuarta de la izquierda viste saco corto y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the communal bank "Damas Triunfadoras", which is comprised of six members.  She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children.  Vilma and her husband run a family business and they both work to give their children a better education.  A few years ago they started a car wash and tire business.  Vilma is in charge of customer service and most of the customers are taxi drivers and transportation drivers.  Thanks to her charisma, the customers are always satisfied.  She is proud of the work she does; and seeing it prosper day after day is what gives her the greatest happiness.

The loan she has requested is to buy automobile tires and accessories.  In the future she wants to continue growing and open another shop.  Vilma is grateful to the KIVA lenders who have confidence in her and the communal bank.

*Vilma is pictured fourth from the left in the short vest and black pants.

loans.use: To buy automobile tires and accessories.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household or the educational needs of children. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, zippers, ribbons and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase thread, buttons, zippers, ribbons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle, 30 years of age, is married to a loving husband who works as a welder. They blessed with three children. 

Michelle has engaged in a vegetable vending business for almost 14 years. She's earning a net income of PHP 2,000 daily. She wants to take a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase pineapples and oranges to sell. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can utilize it properly.

loans.use: To purchase pineapples and oranges to sell

location.town: Christine Village, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabe

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Mrs. Nergui, 49 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in its old house on a plot of land. She has recently begun renting and running a fast food restaurant. Her daughter is an executive officer at a fitness club. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years due to not receiving any repair since its operation. Therefore, Nergui is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, metal, fiberglass and foam. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place due to renovation and reduce the vulnerability of the walls against frost and storms. 

The advantage of a high quality house is it enables the family to burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia, tiene 62 años, es madre soltera y vive en su casa propia junto uno de sus tres hijos. Adilia se dedica a la venta de alimentos para el consumo humano, principalmente plátanos, limones, yuca, frutas, entre otros; compra estos productos directamente de los pobladores del campo o comunidades nativas, luego ella los trae a la ciudad y los ofrece a buenos precios. Realiza esta actividad hace 20 años, lo hace con mayor énfasis cuando en la ciudad se celebra alguna festividad importante; por otro lado vende ropas usadas y productos de perfumería de manera eventual. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener contacto con las personas, y sobre todo se siente feliz porque puede generar sus propios ingresos económicos para continuar solventado sus gastos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1800, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará gallinas de chacra, plátanos por racimos y hojas de “bijao” para venderlos por las fiestas patronales.
texts.en:
Adilia, 62, is a single mother and lives in her own house with one of her three children.  She sells food such as bananas, lemons, yucca plant, fruits, etc.  She buys the products directly from the farmers or native communities and brings them to the city to sell at good prices.  For 20 years she has been in business and work activity is always higher in the city when some important festivity is being celebrated.  She also sells used clothing and perfume products on a temporary basis.

What she enjoys about her work is the fact that she can be in contact with people.  She is happy to be able to generate her own income and cover her expenses.  On this occasion, she is requesting 1,800 PEN.  She is grateful and content knowing she can continue counting on financial support so her business can prosper.  The loan will be used to buy hens, bananas and "bijao" leaves to sell during the patron saint celebrations.

loans.use: To buy hens and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Illuminada

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Illuminada works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs.  Illuminada is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Illuminada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gemma requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods like biscuits, milk, coffee, cream, detergent soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

Gemma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods like biscuits, milk, coffee, cream, detergent soap, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cirile

texts.en: Cirile is a young Cameroonian, age 21, living and doing business in an urban area. He is married with a child about 11 months old. He has been in this business for the past three years, which makes him very experienced and stable and his business is very profitable. He has a 60 percent chance of succeeding in this business. This loan will help him increase his output by 20 percent as well as his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his store

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 38 years old and married with four children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Jessica has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from food vending and buying and selling firewood.

Jessica aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old and married with three children. With all three children currently in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell like snack foods, sugar, coffee, eggs, noodles, dried fish, etc. in her general store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, coffee, eggs, noodles, dried fish, etc. 

Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell like snack foods, sugar, coffee, eggs, noodles, dried fish, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juanita is 49 years old and has four children who are in school.

Juanita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Juanita has been in this business for 10 years. Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like bananas, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her business.

Judith has been in this business for three years. Judith earns more income from raising pigs.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like bananas, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her business

loans.name: 4 Cats Group

texts.en:
4 cats is a group composed of five Filipino ladies who all work as housekeepers for Lebanese families. They decided to form the group in order to support each other financially and improve the socioeconomic situation of their respective families. 

Susan is the leader and featured member of this group. She is a 50-year-old married mother of five children, standing on the far left of the picture. Her husband is currently unemployed, which means that her entire family depends on her salary. However, all her children are enrolled in schools, and her income is barely enough to provide for one person. Thus, she decided to acquire the group loan from Al Majmoua to settle the schooling tuition fees of her children. This would allow her children to acquire the proper education she did not have the opportunity to obtain.

As for the other group members, Marilou is the lady wearing a cap, Sahlee is the woman wearing a pink shirt, Anecita is the lady standing on the far right of the picture, while Elisa is the woman standing left of Anecita.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees of her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rivets and sprays

loans.name: Mirsada

texts.ru: Мирсаде 48 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей (2сына и 2 дочери). С 1985 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 3000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день, Мирсада смогла развить своё хозяйство и полеводческую деятельность - в хозяйстве имеется 3 дойные коровы и 1 теленок, а также имеется 1,80 га поливной земли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства, Мирсада обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120 000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, а также на покупку минеральных удобрений. Доходы от кредита Мирасада  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве, на реконструкцию дома, а также хочет приготовить приданное для дочери.
texts.en: Mirsada is 48 years old, she is married and has four children: two sons and two daughters. Since 1985 she has started animal husbandry and field crop cultivation with an amount of 3,000 som (KGS). Today Mirsada was able to grow her business and crop cultivation and has three milk cows and one calf as well as 1.80 hectares of arable land which she sows with beans. With the purpose to further grow her business Mirsada has come to Microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 120,000 KGS to buy cattle  as well as mineral fertilizer. She plans to invest the income from the loan to increase the headcount of livestock and to remodel her house as well as prepare dоwry for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy cattle and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bibisoro

texts.ru: Бибисоро 26 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Бибисоро очень умная и целеустремленная женщина. Она работает в школе учительницей. Бибисоро поступила в Педагогический Институт, так как она окончила Педагогический колледж и имеет среднее специальное образование. Она хочет получить высшее образование и таким образом усовершенствовать свои знания и подняться по карьерной лестнице. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bibisoro is 26 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Bibisoro is a very smart and purposeful woman. She works as a school teacher. Since she completed a teaching college and already has a secondary level vocational education, Bibisoro got admitted into a teaching institute. She wants to get a higher education to improve her skills and climb the career ladder. She doesn't have the money  to pay for her education. She is requesting a loan to pay for her training and awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition at the Pedagogical Institute

loans.name: Marylene

texts.en:
Marylene is 54 years old and married with 3 children.

Marylene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase canned goods, soap, soft-drinks and other miscellaneous items.

Marylene has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Marylene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soap, soft-drinks and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Benkan  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKAN II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FALAN, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  TENINKO , 4 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 175.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkan II group are married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 6 children, who all live in polygamous families in Falan, one of the villages of Sanankoroba, the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 8th loan from the institution. Their previous loans have been repaid.

Teninko, standing second from the right in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 1.5 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold at the village market to a clientèle made up of resellers and consumers. She expects to have made a profit of 175 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour fees and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Benkan  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKAN III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FALAN un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est  le arachide  avec TENIN , 1 ere assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 180.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The 10 members of the Benkan III group are married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 5 children, who all live in polygamous families in Falan, one of the villages of Sanankoroba, the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 8th loan from the institution.

Tenin, sitting on the left in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold at the village market to a clientèle made up of resellers and consumers. She expects to have made a profit of 180 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour wages and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Benkan Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKAN  IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FALAN, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec  KIATOU , 1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkan IV group are married women with an average age of 35 and, on average, 6 children, who all live in polygamous families in Falan, one of the villages of Sanankoroba, the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 8th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Kiatou, standing on the left in the picture, grows millet. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold at the village market to a clientèle made up of resellers and consumers. She expects to have made a profit of 125 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour wages and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a food stall owner and sells variety of food products. She is 42 years old and has three children. Her net income is usually is about PHP 5,000 every month which is used as revolving capital in the business, school fees and daily meals. She wants to continue to improve her income which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy breads, biscuits, soft drinks, rice, vegetables and meat to sell in her food stall. 

Marivic hopes to keep improving her revenues to save funds for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy breads, biscuits, soft drinks, rice, vegetables and meat to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Vicitacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vicitacion works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  
Vicitacion is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like bananas, sugar, bamboo sticks etc. for her food vending business.

Vicitacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like bananas, sugar, bamboo sticks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 55 years old and married with five children. With one child currently in school, Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, rice, coffee and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Victoria has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, rice, coffee and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Betchie

texts.en:
Betchie is married, 35 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Betchie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Betchie requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Betchie has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Betchie would like to save money to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 22 years old, married and has one infant-age child. To earn a living, he cultivates their farm land by planting rice and vegetables for additional source of income. He operates his motorcycle transport business for a living. In this regard, he plans to continuously use his motorcycle transport to generate income. 

He is asking for an a loan of Php 6,000.00  to buy gasoline, wheels and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He hopes that his loan will be granted so that he will be able to continue using his motorcycle transport to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jenevie

texts.en:
Jenevie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling school supplies in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more school supplies to sell.

Jenevie has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Jenevie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Sherley

texts.en: Sherley is 51 years old, and she owns and manages a retail store in her village where she sells sugar, oil, and spices. She cares for her business because it is a great help in improving her family's economic living. For this business, she's requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, biscuits, soy sauce and bread as additional commodities to sell. Aside from her retail store, she operates a piggery as an additional source of income.  She hopes to gain more profits through these businesses to provide a better way of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, cooking oil, biscuits, soy sauce and bread.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: Agueda, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada, y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus tres hijos. Agueda se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, para esto instala todos los días por las tardes sus mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y su hijo mayor quienes le apoyan en la preparación y atención en sus ratos libres. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos que usa para solventar los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a su esposo. Para hacer su negocio más estable, le gustaría alquilar un local donde tendría todo listo para la trabajar cómodamente. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de  todas sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará mesas y sillas, así como ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como papas, carnes, aceites, harinas y condimentos.
texts.en: Agueda is 31 years old, married and lives in her own house alongside her husband and three children.  Every afternoon Agueda sets up her chairs and tables to serve her customers and make a living selling fast food.  She receives help from her husband and eldest son, who support her in preparing and serving the food in their free time.  Agueda likes her business as she earns an income to pay for household costs and to support her husband.  In order to give her business more stability, Agueda would like to hire premises where she would have everything in order to work more comfortably.  On this occasion she is applying for 1500 Nuevo Soles and is very happy to have financial support in order to continue with her work.  Agueda promises to make all her repayments on time.  She will use the loan to buy tables and chairs, as well as ingredients, such as potatoes, meats, oil, flour and condiments, to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs, as well as ingredients for preparing her meals.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en: Ganchimeg, 38, lives with her husband and 3 children in a ger in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Batsuuri, is 34, has worked at mining company as a  driver of a big truck for years. Her older son is senior student at a local secondary school and her 2 daughters go to a local kindergarten. Ganchimeg and her husband bought a truck for providing transportation services in town in August 2012. Ganchimeg is in charge of collecting the payments and dealing with customers. She and her husband make a good team as transportation providers. They currently need to replace the wheels of their truck to continue their business and are therefore requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase 4 wheels. She and her husband are hardworking and responsible people.

loans.use: to purchase 4 wheels to continue her family's transportation business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 53 years old and married with four children. With one child who is in school, Lanie works very hard to provide for her family.

Lanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Lanie has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Lanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Letty

texts.es:
Letty, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada, con muchas ganas de salir adelante con sus propios méritos. Es madre soltera de una niña de 1 año de edad respectivamente, con quien vive en la casa de sus padres. Letty se dedica a la venta de perfumes, adornos, aretes, collares, entre otros. También hace servicio de manicure, actividad que realiza desde su casa donde cuenta con los materiales y accesorios necesarios, brindando una buena atención a sus clientes. Se inició hace más de 2 años con un capital propio, luego fue aumentando sus productos para así tener más clientes contentos. Decidió empezar con sus actividades debido al deseo de contar con sus propios ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a su familia. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual
Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles comprará adornos, aretes, collares , perfumes , entre otros.
texts.en:
Letty is 27 years old.  She is hard-working, dedicated and has a great desire to move ahead under her own steam.  Letty is a single mother to a one-year-old girl.  Letty and her daughter live in Letty's parents' house.  Letty makes a living selling perfumes, adornments, earrings, necklaces and other items.  In addition she offers manicures from her home, where she has the necessary materials and accessories.  She provides good service to her customers.  Letty started the business over two years ago with her own capital.  Later she increased the number of products that she offered in order to have happier customers.  Letty chose to start this business as she wanted to have her own income and support her parents with household costs and to move forward in life.  This is Letty's third Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial support that she receives in order to get ahead. Letty promises to make her repayments on time.

With this loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles, Letty will buy adornments, necklaces, earrings and more.

loans.use: to buy adornments, necklaces, earrings and more.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Leonides is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Leonides requested an 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Leonides has been buying and selling livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her work. 

Leonides would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa, 60, is a married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nerissa has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Nerissa requested a 23000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

Nerissa has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Nerissa would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plaster, paint, and cement for the façade of his house.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
When Ricardo opened his business in 2003 to increase his financial independence, he continued to work an additional full-time job. He led this lifestyle until 2009 when his company was bought out and his department was shut down. Rather than search for another job, he decided to invest himself full-time in his business and to provide his clients with three types of services: accounting, individual and corporate taxes, and payroll. He currently has 250 clients for individual taxes, 50 for corporate taxes, 40 for monthly accounting and 25 for payroll. 

Last February, Ricardo decided to get a virtual office with Regus in order to give his business a more professional aspect. The largest difficulty he has run into is with marketing, a problem he hopes to alleviate with this loan.

Ricardo is especially passionate about his business because it allows him to work on what he studied in the past. He currently lives with his former wife, as they decided it would be best for their daughters.

loans.use: to invest in a marketing strategy and purchase additional home office equipment/furniture.

loans.name: Mov

texts.en: Mov (in the photo with his wife), age 51, is a house builder. His wife, Nary, age 48, stays at home and does housework. They have been married since 1983 and have three daughters. Two are married, and one is a weaver in a weaving factory. The family lives in a village about 38 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mov is applying for his first Kiva loan, in the amount of $1,000, to buy more materials for his house building business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his house building business.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina was born in Japan and moved to the U.S. when she was 4 years old. She has always loved animals, and she started rescuing kittens and cats when she was a teenager. Her dream is to become a veterinarian. 

Following this dream, she was admitted by Cal Poly Pomona to study Animal Science. Unfortunately, her mother was killed when she was 17 years old. She had to leave the school to find a job to support her family. The cats and dogs she rescued during this period helped her make it through the grieving process and cope with the challenge of having to leave school and help support her family.
 
She has worked as a real estate agent to support her family, but her passion lies in helping animals. She knew that she needed to pursue a career that would not only make her happy, but make a difference in society and the animal world as well. Now, with her husband’s support, she has decided that this is the time to start pursuing her dream. 

Christina decided to start a mobile pet grooming business. Her own money is just enough to buy a van but not enough to change it into a grooming facility. Christina did not qualify for a loan from a bank. A $9,976 Kiva loan from PACE will help her transform the van into a mobile pet grooming facility so that she can start working towards her dream. She also has a non-profit animal rescue organization and a non-profit animal hospital. The profit from this mobile pet grooming business will be used in those two organizations.

loans.use: to transform a van into a mobile pet grooming facility

loans.name: Asymas

texts.en: Asymas (pictured here) had taken out a Kiva loan. She is now applying for another loan, in the amount of $1,000, to repair the walls of her house and buy a motorbike for commuting. Her husband is a fisherman. Asymas sells the fish that her husband catches in the local market. They have three sons and three daughters; one is a construction worker, one is a garment worker, two attend school and one is still young. The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to repair the walls of her house and buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Pho (pictured here) is 45 years old and her husband, Sokha, is 43 years old. They are morning-glory farmers. The couple live in a Phnom Penh suburb, and they have two children, one son and one daughter. Both of their children attend school. Pho is applying for her Kiva loan to buy a cow to raise. She will also use a part of the loan to add to her own money and buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise and to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun (pictured with grandsons) is a rice farmer, while her husband is a house builder and assists his wife in the farming business when he is free. The couple has been married since 1985 and they have four children. One daughter is married and lives outside the family home. Two are garment workers and one son is attending school. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Khun is asking for a loan. She will use a part of the loan to buy a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to work and the rest to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to work and to buy a cow.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 52 years old from Nyahururu. He has a cereal shop that he has operated for the past nine years.

He has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy cereals and potatoes.  He paid his previous loan on time.

He hopes to expand the business with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, hopes to expand his business to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy cereals and potatoes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 37 years old and married to Jessica. They have three children, ages 10 years old, 5 years old, and 1 year old.

He has a car wash center in Nakuru which he has operated for the past three years. He also has a BodaBoda (bicycle taxi). Joseph has applied for his third loan from Kadet ltd to enable him to buy equipment for his car wash business. He will use the anticipated profit to furnish his rental houses.

In the near future, he hopes to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy equipment to wash cars.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 47 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nancy has a general store in the Philippines. Nancy applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries for her store, including bread, biscuits and noodles. Nancy has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store, including bread, biscuits and noodles.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en: Nicolasa works hard to support her family. Nicolasa is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Nicolasa applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients, including sugar and bananas, for her food production business. Nicolasa has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Nicolasa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, including sugar and bananas, for her food production business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 59 years old, married, and has seven children. Anecita works very hard to provide for them. Anecita runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Anecita has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. In the future Anecita would like to build and expand her business in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Batchiba

texts.en:
Batchiba is 44 years old, married and has five children. Three of her children are in school.

Batchiba is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Batchiba has been raising pigs for eight years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Batchiba requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and additional pigs.

In the future, Batchiba would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional pigs.

loans.name: Jezeibel

texts.en:
Jezeibel is 34 years old and married with four children, who are all in school. Jezeibel works very hard to provide for them.

Jezeibel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries.  

Jezeibel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Jezeibel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en:
Asima is a 38-years-old hardworking housewife. She has no child. Her husband owns a vegetable shop which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases a variety of fresh and seasonal vegetables from the field and sells them in the main market. Presently, he needs to purchase vegetables for his shop. For that his wife Asima has requested for a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase vegetables. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to increase his net income. With the help of profit Asima wants to get a better treatment and prays that Allah blessed her with a child soon. 

Asima prays for the success of her husband’s business. She is feeling relaxed and happy after taking the loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Siyang

texts.en: Siyang and her husband ,Van Dy, are farmers. They grow corn and potatoes. Siyang hopes to continue her farming because it’s her main source of income. Hence she applying for loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides, and she will also use a part of the loan to buy a water pump and pipes to water her farm. Siyang and her husband live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have three children, one son and two daughters. All of the children are now garment workers.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and pipes to water her farm and to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 60 years old and married to Rhoda, and they have six children between 18 and 8 years old.

He is a farmer from Olkalau and has been in this business for the past 22 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.
 
He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy fertilizer and seeds.

He hopes to see his children well educated and increase his farm outputs in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She sells hides and skins from livestock to shoes, bags and leather makers. She has been in this business for the past 5 years.

This will be her third loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more hides and skins to sell. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to supply the hides and skins to all the leather and shoes making industries and become successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy hides and skins for selling.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: Apolonia is 59 years old, married, and has one child. Apolonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks, includuing shampoo, bath soap, cooking oil, sugar, milk and cream, to sell in her store. Apolonia has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the store for 12 years, and she earns additional income from selling electronic charges. Apolonia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks, including shampoo, bath soap, cooking oil, sugar, milk and cream, to sell in her general store

loans.name: Arabela

texts.en: Arabela is 57 years old, married, and has five children. Arabela works very hard to provide for them. Arabela runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Arabela has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, Arabela would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: Cresencia is 67 years old, widowed, and has one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cresencia has a general store business in the Philippines. She has applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. Cresencia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Cresencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Charminda

texts.en:
Charminda is 28 years old and married with one child. Charminda works very hard to provide for her family.

Charminda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, milk, coffee, noodles, bread, etc. 

Charminda requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods like snack foods, soft drinks, milk, coffee, noodles, bread, etc., to sell in her general store.

Charminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods like snack foods, soft drinks, milk, coffee, noodles, bread, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family. Daisy is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Daisy requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

Daisy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn works hard to support her family. Genelyn is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear clothes business in the Philippines.

Genelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell.

Genelyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Genelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready to wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 53 years old and single. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Girlie has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Girlie requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products for her business.

Girlie has been in this business for 20 years. Girlie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
